The following teams participated in the ''Race'', each listed along with their placements in each leg and relationships as identified by the program. Note that this table is not necessarily reflective of all content broadcast on television, owing to the inclusion or exclusion of some data. Placements are listed in finishing order:

thumb: red}} team placement means the team was eliminated.

250px]]: cyan ⋑}} indicates that the team chose to use one of the two U-Turns in a Double U-Turn; {{brown
column5: ⋐}} indicates the team who received it; {{sup sub
column9: ⋑}}}} indicates that the team was U-Turned, but they used the second U-Turn on another team; {{brown
column11: ⋑}} indicates that the team voted for the recipient.

thumb: <u>underlined blue</u>}} team's placement indicates that the team came in last on a non-elimination leg and had to perform a [[The Amazing Race#Speed Bump
250px]]: Speed Bump]] during the next leg of the ''Race''.

thumb: orange +}} next to a leg number indicates that there was a [[The Amazing Race#Double Battle/Face Off/Head-to-Head
250px]]: Head-to-Head]] on that leg of the Race, while an {{orange (color)
column4: orange −}} indicates the team that lost the final Head-to-Head and was eliminated.

thumb: 1}} Art & JJ were given a four-hour penalty because Art elected to quit the second Roadblock. Rupert & Laura, the only team trailing, finished the Roadblock and checked-in at the Pit Stop during the penalty time, eliminating Art & JJ.
2}} The Head-to-Head in Leg 4 was unaired.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: At the start of the eighth leg, teams met at the [[Ballenberg]] Community Hall and voted for who should receive the U-Turn. The two teams who received the most votes was penalized with the U-Turn and had to complete both Detour options. The vote was an [[Open ballot system
thumb: open vote]] and the voting order was determined by a random draw. The team's votes, as well as the voting order, is outlined below.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Episode titles are often taken from quotes made by the racers.<ref>{{cite web
#\"I'm a Bird, I'm a Plane, I'm on The Amazing Race\" – ''Korey''
#\"This One is For One Million Dollars\" – ''Christie''
The prize for each leg was awarded to the first place team for that leg. Trips were provided by [[Travelocity]]. The prizes were:
*'''Leg 1''' – A seven day cruise for two to [[French Polynesia]]
*'''Leg 3''' – A trip for two to [[The Bahamas]]
*'''Leg 4''' – A trip for two to the [[Dominican Republic]]
*'''Leg 7''' – A spa day during the Pit Stop
*'''Leg 8''' – A seven night river cruise for two to [[Vietnam]] & [[Cambodia]]

250px]]: Complete race map and countries visited during the season]]

column4: At the end of the first leg of the Race in [[Tokyo]], teams had to climb up steps to reach the Pit Stop at [[Atago Shrine (Tokyo)

thumb: flight}} [[Los Angeles]] ([[Los Angeles International Airport]]) to [[Greater Tokyo Area

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Tokyo (Shibuya – [https://totalwork.jp/ ACB Lock & Security] ''or'' [http://www.agooddiner.com/sp-mameyakko_shibuya.html Tokyo Tokyo Restaurant])

250px]]: Who wants a sweet new pair of shoes?}}

column4: Who wants to climb Mount Fuji?}}

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the first Roadblock of the ''Race'', one team member had to take part in \"Who wants a sweet new pair of shoes?\", which was inspired by the [[Japanese variety show
thumb: Japanese-style game show]] ''Candy or Not Candy''. They had pick one of several [[Geta (footwear)
250px]]: getas]] and bite the sandal until they found one of twelve made of [[chocolate]]. When they found the correct geta, both team members had to eat the chocolate up to a red line to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For the second Roadblock of the leg, the team member that did not perform the previous Roadblock had to change into a blue [[unitard]] and wig and had to climb up a {{convert
column5: adj=on}} slippery slope that resembled [[Mount Fuji]] to retrieve their next clue at the summit.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After [[Phil Keoghan]] said \"Go,\" teams had to run down the pier to a giant [[octopus]]-shaped [[Sand art and play
thumb: sand sculpture]] on the adjacent beach and dig for their first clue that would reveal their first destination.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Upon arrival in [[Japan]], teams traveled by a chartered open-top bus to [[Shibuya]]. After disembarking the bus, teams were given a clue, which instructed them to travel on foot to one of two locations to receive their next clue. Each location had a limited number of clues.
*After the first Roadblock, teams had to travel by taxi to [[Onarimon Station]] and then make their way to nearby [[Shiba Park
thumb: Shiba Koen]] to search for their next clue.

column4: Teams began their leg in [[Luang Prabang]] at [[Wat Sen]]soukharam by giving [[alms]] of rice to [[monk]]s.]]

thumb: flight}} Tokyo (Narita International Airport) to [[Luang Prabang]], '''[[Laos]]''' {{flagicon

column4: BBQ}} Luang Prabang (Ecole Maternelle Louang Prabang ''or'' BBQ Alley)

250px]]: Who likes to be in command?}}

thumb: boat}} Luang Prabang ([[Wat Xieng Thong]]) to Ban Xiengkeo ([[Xiengkeo Palace

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The first Detour of the ''Race'' was a choice between ABC and BBQ. In ABC, teams had to make their way on foot to Ecole Maternelle Louang Prabang and had to learn the [[Lao script
thumb: Laotian alphabet]] from a teacher. After learning the alphabet, teams had to pass an oral exam to receive their next clue. In BBQ, teams had to make their way on foot to BBQ Alley and had to purchase three ducks and eight [[tilapia]]s. They then had to prepare eleven Lao barbecue skewers exactly like the skewers prepared during an ongoing demonstration. If the skewers were properly made, teams would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to learn a series of [[Lao language
thumb: Lao]] commands and use these commands to direct an [[Asian elephant
column4: Nam Khan River]]. Once across, they had to search on their elephant for two men playing [[Hmong music]] on [[Lusheng
column5: qeejs]]. When found, team members would receive their next clue and had to direct their elephant back to Elephant Village to reunite with their partner.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After arriving in [[Luang Prabang]], teams had to travel by [[Auto rickshaw
thumb: tuk-tuk]] to Villa Santi and wait for their next clue to arrive by [[courier]] before sunrise. The clue gave them their next task, to take part in the local morning [[alms]] and give servings of [[Glutinous rice#Lao
250px]]: sticky rice]] to a procession of [[Buddhism in Laos
column4: Buddhist]] [[monk]]s at [[Wat Sen]]soukharam. Before the monks' arrival, each team member had to don a [[Sabai
column5: pha biang]] and pick up basket of rice for the offering. After the monks passed, teams received their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After the Roadblock, teams had to travel by tuk-tuk to [[Wat Xieng Thong]], where they would board a [[long-tail boat]] and travel to the Pit Stop.

250px]]: Teams spent the majority of the third leg in Downtown [[Ho Chi Minh City]].]]

thumb: flight}} Luang Prabang (Luang Prabang International Airport) to [[Ho Chi Minh City]], '''[[Vietnam]]''' {{flagicon

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Ho Chi Minh City ([http://fitomuseum.com.vn House of Vietnamese Medicine])

column4: Light It Up}} Ho Chi Minh City (Thanh Đa Restaurant ''or'' [http://creatv.com/ The CREATV Company Film Studio])

250px]]: Who's ready to tune out?}} Ho Chi Minh City ([http://kingdomcorporation.vn/thuong-hieu/kingdom-karaoke-tran-quang-khai/ Kingdom Karaoke])

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Ho Chi Minh City (Hồ Thị Kỷ Flower Market) {{TAR clue

This leg's Detour was a choice between Reel It In and Light It Up. In Reel It In, teams had to make their way to Thanh Đa Restaurant and catch eight [[prawn]]s from the pool inside the restaurant using fishing poles to receive their next clue. In Light It Up, teams had to make their way to The CREATV Company film studio and learn a dance. When ready, they would don a \"glowsuit\" covered with [[electroluminescent wire]] and had to dance in sync alongside local dancers and ''[[Asia's Got Talent (season 2)
thumb: Asia's Got Talent]]'' contestants 218 Dance Crew to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to learn the [[Vietnamese language
250px]]: Trúc Nhân]]'s song \"Thật Bất Ngờ\" and then perform [[karaoke]] in front of an audience. If they sang the lyrics correctly, they would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At the start of the leg, teams were provided a [[smartphone]] with the Travelocity app to book their flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
*At the House of Vietnamese Medicine, teams had to find a doctor, who would give them a packet of [[Herbalism
thumb: herbal remedies]], which contained their next clue.

column4: One of the Detour options involved assembling a [[bamboo]] [[water wheel]] at the [[Bình Quới Tourist Village

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Ho Chi Minh City ([https://snowtownsaigon.com/ SnowTown Saigon]) {{TAR clue
*Ho Chi Minh City ([http://sathachlaixetw3.edu.vn/ College Transportation Central]) {{TAR clue
250px]]: Who feels like driving themselves crazy?}}

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Ho Chi Minh City ([[Bình Quới Tourist Village

column4: Badminton; Not aired}} Ho Chi Minh City (Tầm Vu Park) {{TAR clue

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For their Speed Bump, Chris & Bret had to fill a [[cooler]] with [[snowball]]s in simulated snow storm conditions and deliver the cooler to College Transportation Central in order to continue racing.
In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to pass a Vietnamese [[driving test]] by driving a [[Scooter (motorcycle)
thumb: scooter]] through a figure-eight and over a series of speed bumps without touching the ground or driving outside the yellow lines to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The Detour was a choice between Irritation and Irrigation. In Irritation, teams had to paddle a basket boat {{convert
column5: abbr=on}} while avoiding fishermen on boats and moving their boat over bridges in order to pick up a basket of five fish. They then had to paddle back to the start and exchange the fish and the basket for their next clue. In Irrigation, teams had to assemble a [[bamboo]] [[water wheel]] to the satisfaction of a farmer and then use the water wheel to fill a jar with water to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At SnowTown Saigon, teams had to grab a sled and ride it down an indoor slope to a person dressed as a [[polar bear]], who would give them their next clue.
*After the Detour, teams had to travel by bus and then on foot to Tầm Vu Park adjacent to the Thanh Đa Canal.<ref>{{cite web
250px]]: title=Team Fun's Leg 4 Amazing Race 31 Recap

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Tầm Vu Park, teams encountered a Head-to-Head, which went unaired during the episode. According to Nicole & Victor and Corinne & Eliza, two teams had to compete against each other in a game of [[badminton]]. The team that won the Head-to-Head could check-in at the nearby Pit Stop, while the team that lost the Head-to-Head had to wait for the next team. The team that lost the final Head-to-Head was eliminated from the ''Race''.<ref>{{cite podcast
thumb: title=EP15: Amazing Race Season 31 w/ Corinne & Eliza

250px]]: At the end of the leg in [[Dubai]], teams [[zip line
column4: zip-lined]] to the [[Dubai Marina]], which served as the fifth Pit Stop of the Race.]]

thumb: flight}} Ho Chi Minh City (Tan Son Nhat International Airport) to [[Dubai]], '''[[United Arab Emirates]]''' {{flagicon

column4: Find}} Dubai ([[Burj Khalifa]] – Mission 828 ''or'' [http://www.dubaigardenglow.com/ Dubai Garden Glow] – Dinosaur Park)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Fall and Find. In Fall, teams had to make their way to the [[Burj Khalifa]] and choose a [[jumpmaster]], who would take them up the building. There, teams would discover that they had to don a [[virtual reality headset]] and use the controls to find a signal interceptor, climb to the top of a simulated Burj Khalifa spire, intercept a [[satellite]], and parachute to the base of the building. After the jump, both team members had to correctly answer a test to receive their next clue, otherwise they would have to attempt the task again. The five questions were: (1) At what height are you in the Burj Khalifa? ({{convert
column5: abbr=on}}); (2) What color was the lever you turned? (Red); (3) What else was inside the glass you broke? ([[Fire hose]]); (4) Did the observation deck door open in or out? (Out); (5) How many antennae were on the signal interceptor? (4). Only two teams could attempt this task at a time. In Find, teams had to make their way to Dubai Garden Glow and don ''[[Tyrannosaurus
column6: Tyrannosaurus Rex]]'' costumes. They then had to search Dinosaur Park for a white, a red, a purple, a blue, and a green glowing [[dinosaur egg]] and place the eggs in a nest to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to enter a [[silent disco
thumb: silent rave]] and had to find a partygoer dancing to the same music as the [[Disc jockey
250px]]: DJ]], a remix of ''The Amazing Race'' theme,<!--as sung by Floyd in the taxi ride to the Pit Stop--> using only their sight to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After arriving in Dubai, teams had to travel to a \"[[supercar]] [[tailgate party]]\". After sampling tea and [[Date palm#Fruit
thumb: dates]], teams would be directed to their next clue inside a supercar.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Amwaj Tower 4, teams had to make their way to the top of the building and ride the world's longest urban [[zip line]] to the Pit Stop at the [[Dubai Marina]]. The order teams arrived at the top of the tower would be the order they would check-in at the Pit Stop.

column4: After arriving in [[Kampala]], teams had to climb up the [[minaret]] of the [[Uganda National Mosque]].]]

250px]]: Ngoma Drum Stacks}} Kampala ([https://jahazipier.business.site/ Jahazi Pier] overlooking Lake Victoria) {{TAR clue

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to find a vendor, who would give them a shopping list. They then had to purchase the ingredients from the list and use their ingredients to properly prepare a [[Rolex (food)
thumb: rolex]] to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For their Speed Bump, Rachel & Elissa had to hand-wash clothes and then hang them to dry in order to continue racing.

This leg's Detour was a choice between Salty Roll and Move the Pole. In Salty Roll, teams had to bring a wheelbarrow full of the largest freshwater fish in Africa, the [[Nile perch]], to a workstation. They then had to properly [[Salting (food)
thumb: salt]] and roll the fish skin and had to wash, gut, and salt the meat to receive their next clue. In Move the Pole, teams had to load firewood from a canoe onto a bicycle and deliver the wood to a market. There, teams had to stack the wood like a finished example. Once teams delivered and stacked enough wood to reach a specified height, they would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the only aired Head-to-Head of the ''Race'', one member from each competing team had to solve a puzzle similar to the [[Tower of Hanoi]] that consisted of four stacks of [[Ngoma drums]]. Team members had to move one drum at a time until each stack consisted of drums of the same color and grab an ox tail in order to win the Head-to-Head and check-in at the nearby Pit Stop. The team that lost the Head-to-Head had to wait for the next team, and the team that lost the final Head-to-Head was eliminated from the ''Race''.

*At Uganda National Mosque, teams had to don customary clothing. After finding their clue, teams had to climb to the top of the mosque's [[minaret]], counting the marked-steps along the way. If they came up with the correct number (272), they would receive their next clue.
*At Ggaba Landing Site, teams had to find the village boat builders to receive their next clue.

column4: Swiss]] [[Bernese Alps]] served as the backdrop of this leg.]]

thumb: flight}} Kampala (Entebbe International Airport) to [[Zurich metropolitan area

250px]]: Zürich Airport Railway Station]]) to [[Grindelwald]] ([[Grindelwald railway station
Who wants to take the scenic route?}}

thumb: helicopter}} Grindelwald (Gletscherschlucht Glacier Gorge) to [[Guttannen]] ([[Grimsel Pass]])

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member would be harnessed to a canyon swing. They would then free-fall {{convert
column4: m}} and swing into the Gletscherschlucht. After the swing, they would then have to search the gorge for their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Water Power and Water Down. In Water Power, teams had to ride the [[Gelmer Funicular
thumb: Gelmerbahn]]. During the ride, teams had to memorize eight signs that listed [[Reservoir
250px]]: water basins]] and amount of water they hold. When their ride ended, teams had to run across a [[Hydroelectricity
column4: hydroelectric dam]] and match the eight basin names to their water capacities on a technical map to receive their next clue. Otherwise, they would have to ride the Gelmerbahn again. In Water Down, teams had to go [[Canyoning
column5: canyoneering]] in the Grimsel Canyon. They had to [[Abseiling
column9: m}} down a canyon, jump from a ledge into a glacial river, and then jump to grab their next clue hanging from a rope. After retrieving their clue, team members had to ride a zip-line and release themselves to drop down into a river before hiking out of the canyon.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After teams completed the Roadblock, they had to make their way to a helicopter, which would take them to [[Grimsel Pass]], where they would find their next clue.

column4: After the Roadblock, teams traveled by boat across [[Lake Brienz]] to the Grand Hotel Giessbach in [[Brienz]], the eighth Pit Stop of the Race.]]

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Hofstetten bei Brienz (Ballenberg Open Air Museum) {{TAR clue
column5: This Detour options on teams' clues were listed as Haymaking and Cow Dressing; however, the graphics on the show listed the Detour options as Make Hay and Cow Festival.}}

250px]]: Who wants to be a big shot?}}

thumb: boat}} [[Brienz]] ([https://www.pirate-bay.ch/ Bootsverleih Brienz] to [[:de: Grandhotel Giessbach

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For their Speed Bump, Nicole & Victor had to fold the 26 [[Flags and arms of cantons of Switzerland
thumb: Swiss canton flags]] in the Ballenberg Community Hall and place them in a basket before they could continue racing.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Haymaking and Cow Dressing. In Haymaking, one team member had to use a [[scythe]] to cut a lane of grass, while their partner raked it. They then had to properly stack the grass so that it could dry into [[hay]] to receive their next clue. In Cow Dressing, teams had to use the provided materials to make a floral headdress and place it on a [[cattle
thumb: cow's]] head. They then had to lead the cow to a festival and would receive their next clue if the headdress was properly made.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to use a [[crossbow]] to shoot an [[apple]] [[Shooting an apple off one's child's head
thumb: off a scarecrow's head]] much like Swiss [[folk hero]] [[William Tell]] to receive their next clue. If team members struck the [[scarecrow]], they had to reassemble it before taking another shot.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Ballenberg Community Hall, teams found host Phil Keoghan, who informed them that they would be voting for who would receive a U-Turn. After each team openly voted, the two teams with the most votes would be U-Turned. Teams could then retrieve their next clue, while Nicole & Victor would find their Speed Bump.

*After the Roadblock, teams had to drive to [[Lake Brienz]]. There, they had to board a [[motorboat]] and drive it across the lake to a marked pier. After disembarking, they could either travel by foot or by [[funicular]] to the Pit Stop.

250px]]: In the old town of [[Split, Croatia
column4: Split]], teams visited the historic [[Diocletian's Palace]] for the Roadblock before rowing across the [[Port of Split]] to the Pit Stop.]]

250px]]: Meiringen Railway Station]]) to Kloten (Zürich Airport Railway Station)

column4: This beach was misidentified on the show's graphics as Kašjuni Beach as Leo & Jamal instructed their taxi driver to take them to Caffe Žbirac on Bačvice Beach, and Becca instructed her taxi driver to take them to Bačvice Beach.}}<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=Let's Split: The Amazing Race Discovers Croatia in Season 31 (VIDEO)

column4: Washed in from the Ocean}} Split ([[:es:Playa Kašjuni

250px]]: Who's ready to get their marching orders?}}

thumb: boat}} Split (St. Nicholas Pier to Matejuška Pier) {{TAR clue

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Poetry in Motion and Washed in from the Ocean. In Poetry in Motion, teams had to memorize a tongue-twisting poem while riding a large [[Tubing (recreation)
thumb: flying tube]] that was towed by a speedboat. After returning ashore, teams had to correctly recite the poem to a poetry master to receive their next clue, otherwise they had to ride the tube again. In Washed in from the Ocean, teams had to go [[snorkeling]] and use a [[metal detector]] to search the [[Adriatic Sea]] for a [[Chalice
250px]]: goblet]] and 5 ancient coins, which they could exchange for their next clue after returning ashore.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to enter the [[Roman Senate
thumb: senator's]] room and watch a troop of 18 [[Roman army
250px]]: Roman soldiers]] march in formation. After the soldiers covered themselves with shields, team members had to correctly identify on a podium the five soldiers wearing red ribbons around their helmets to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Bačvice Beach, each team member had to carry out three drinks of [[Punch (drink)
thumb: punch]] from Caffe Bar Žbirac and bring them to a group of sunbathers, who would give teams a [[Travelocity]] [[Where Is My Gnome?
250px]]: Roaming Gnome]], which they had to keep for the remainder of the leg. After returning the trays to the bartender, teams would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Marjan Cave Church, teams had to use a [[pulley]] to pull their gnome to deliver a loaf of bread up to a [[monk]], who would give them their next clue.
*After the Roadblock, teams had to board a [[dinghy]] and row themselves to the Pit Stop at Matejuška Pier.

column5: Kampen]] required that teams hoist a cow up [[Nieuwe Toren, Kampen

thumb: flight}} Split (Split Airport) to [[Amsterdam metropolitan area

250px]]: Schiphol Airport Railway Station]]) to [[Kampen, Overijssel

column6: Nieuwe Toren]] ''or'' [http://www.erf29.nl Erf 29] and Kampen Market)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between High and Dry. In High, teams had to bike to a farm and load a \"Kamper cow\" onto a [[Trailer (vehicle)
thumb: trailer]] behind a [[tractor]]. They then had to follow the tractor on their bicycle to the [[Nieuwe Toren, Kampen
250px]]: Nieuwe Toren]] and hoist the cow to the top of the tower within forty seconds. If they could raise the cow within the time limit, then one team member had to climb to the top of the [[bell tower]] to receive their next clue. In Dry, teams had to bike to a farm, where both team members had to pole vault across an irrigation ditch \"[[fierljeppen
column4: the Dutch way]]\". They then had to bring two [[List of Dutch cheeses
column5: cheese]] orbs and a dozen eggs back across the ditch and transport them on their bicycle to Kampen Market intact to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Outside the Kampen Railway Station, teams had to search a bicycle parking lot for a marked [[tandem bicycle]], which would serve as their transportation while in [[Kampen, Overijssel

*After leaving the U-Turn board, teams had to return their bicycle to the railway station and pick up a marked car to drive themselves to Smit Giethoorn. There, team had to board a boat and navigate the canals of [[Giethoorn]] to find two marked boats to create a \"boat train\". Teams then had to navigate their boats to the Pit Stop at the island on Bovenwijde Lake.

column4: In [[England]], teams visited [[Dover Castle]], where they had to decipher a hidden message much like the [[World War II cryptography

thumb: flight}} Amsterdam (Amsterdam Airport Schiphol) to [[Greater London
helicopter}} [[Charlwood]] ([[Gatwick Aviation Museum]]) to [[Dover]] ([[Dover Castle]]) {{TAR clue
helicopter}} Dover (Dover Castle) to [[London]] ([https://falconlondonheliport.co.uk/ Falcon London Heliport])
boat}} London ([[Masthouse Terrace Pier]] to [[Savoy Pier]])

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to decipher a [[World War II]] code. They had to listen to a speech from [[Neville Chamberlain]] and pick out the fifteenth, thirtieth, and fourth words. They then had to translate the letters into numbers based on alphabetical order. Under each number was a group of three letters, which teams had to rearrange into numerical order to reveal the final message. Team members then had to type the message on an [[Underwood Typewriter Company
thumb: Underwood Portable typewriter]] and deliver it to a [[Brigadier (United Kingdom)
250px]]: brigadier]] outside the castle's [[barracks]]. If they gave him the correct message of \"The [[Dunkirk evacuation]] has begun. We will never surrender.\", they would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Know and Row. In Know, teams had to ride a [[Hackney carriage
thumb: taxicab]] and had to memorize the fifteen streets and seven landmarks their taxi driver told them during the ride. When teams returned to the [[Cabmen's Shelter Fund
250px]]: cabmen's shelter]] on [[Kensington Road]], they had to correctly recite their route to Dave Cannell, the Master of the [[Worshipful Company of Hackney Carriage Drivers]], to receive their next clue. In Row, teams had to row a [[double scull]] through a {{convert
column7: adj=on}} course on [[The Serpentine]] under one minute to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Gatwick Aviation Museum, teams boarded a helicopter that would take them over the [[Seven Sisters, Sussex
thumb: Seven Sisters]] before landing near [[Dover Castle]], where they would find their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After the Roadblock, teams had to return to their helicopter, which would fly them to [[London]]. After arriving, teams had to find their next clue at [[Masthouse Terrace Pier]], which instructed them to travel by speedboat to [[Savoy Pier]]. After disembarking, teams had to make their way to [[Piccadilly Circus]] and find the [[Living statue
thumb: golden queen]], who would give them their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Camden Market, teams would find the Pit Stop and host Phil Keoghan, who would surprise them with a clue. Teams had to search nearby shops for the marked items in a display and use these items to recreate the display before they could check-in at the Pit Stop.

column5: Fort Wayne]] in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]] served as the Finish Line for ''The Amazing Race 31''.]]

250px]]: Who's good with numbers?}} Detroit ([[Guardian Building]])

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For the final Roadblock of the ''Race'', one team member had to [[Australian rappel
column5: m}} down the [[Guardian Building]]. On the way down, they had to look for a series of numbers that they would need to unlock a [[bank vault]] along with specific turn-by-turn instructions listed in the basement of the building to retrieve their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Fowling Warehouse, teams had to play a game of [[Fowling (sport)
thumb: fowling]] that entailed each team member throwing a [[Ball (gridiron football)
250px]]: football]] towards each other to knock down [[bowling pin]]s until one member knocked down all ten to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Heidelberg Project, teams had to search through a field of ''Race'' clue boxes scattered throughout the [[Public art
thumb: outdoor art installation]] for one that contained their next clue. This task went unaired in the episode.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Amazing Race Season 31 Episodes 11 & 12 with Colin and Christie #RacersRecap

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Third Man Records, teams had to properly [[record press
250px]]: two-tone vinyl records]] using ''Race'' colors. Once all vinyl records were correctly made with a distinct line between colors and properly placed labels, a record worker would hand them their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Hart Plaza, teams had to search amongst a group of [[Rockin' 1000]] musicians to find their next clue atop a drum. Teams then had to assemble a five-piece [[drum kit]] that exactly matched an example, which they couldn't touch, while the musicians played [[The White Stripes]] single \"[[Seven Nation Army]]\". Once the drum kit was correctly assembled, the lead drummer would give teams their final clue.

column7: title=We are at the START of #AmazingRace and we wanted to let you in on a secret, for the first time ever we have alumni from #BigBrother #Survivor and #AmazingRace competing against each other in a reality clash! And as @philiminator put it, \"it's going to be crazy time!\"
title='Amazing Race' films in Detroit; teams rappel down Guardian Building

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: '''''The Amazing Race 31''''' (also promoted as '''''The Amazing Race: Reality Showdown'''''<ref>{{cite web
250px]]: title=GET READY FOR A \"REALITY SHOWDOWN\" ON \"THE AMAZING RACE,\" NOW PREMIERING, WEDNESDAY, APRIL 17 AT 9 PM!
column6: accessdate=December 12, 2019}}</ref>) is the thirty-first installment of the reality television show ''[[The Amazing Race (American TV series)
column7: The Amazing Race]]''. This season features eleven teams of two – each consisting of contestants from previous seasons of ''[[Big Brother (American TV series)
column9: Survivor]]'', and ''The Amazing Race'' – in a race around the world for a US$1 million grand prize. The season premiered on April 17, 2019 and initially aired on CBS's Wednesday 9:00 pm [[Eastern Time Zone
column10: ET]] time slot following ''[[Survivor: Edge of Extinction]]''. Following ''Survivor''{{'}}s season finale, ''The Amazing Race'' was rescheduled to ''Survivor''{{'}}s former time slot of 8:00 pm starting May 22, 2019. The finale aired on its original Wednesday 9:00 pm time slot due to the premiere week for ''[[Big Brother 21 (American season)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Life partners Colin Guinn and [[Christie Lee Woods
thumb: Christie Woods]] from ''[[The Amazing Race 5]]'' were the winners of this season of the ''Race''.

column4: The 31st season of ''The Amazing Race'' began on June 10, 2018 at the [[Hermosa Beach Pier]] and nearby beach in [[Hermosa Beach, California]].]]

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On June 10, 2018, the show announced on its social media accounts that the ''Race'' had begun filming and that the season's teams would be composed of contestants from [[List of programs broadcast by CBS#Reality / non-scripted
thumb: CBS's reality competition programs]].<ref name=\"Instagram\"/> On July 3, 2018, the show concluded in [[Detroit]], which featured a performance of [[The White Stripes]] single \"[[Seven Nation Army]]\" that was originally planned to be set on [[Belle Isle Park (Michigan)
250px]]: Belle Isle Park]]. However, the permit was denied as the [[Michigan Department of Natural Resources]] had not been informed about the large gathering of musicians needed for filming. This season marks the first visit to the state of [[Michigan]] in an ''Amazing Race'' franchise.<ref name=\"freepress\"/>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the lead-in to the [[2018–19 United States network television schedule
thumb: 2018-19 television programming season]], CBS had scheduled ''The Amazing Race 31'' to start airing on May 22, 2019.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=CBS Doubles Down on Unscripted for Midseason
column9: work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}}</ref> However, in early April 2019, CBS opted to bring the premiere forward to April 17, 2019, slotting the show in Wednesdays after ''Survivor'' and replacing the low-rated ''[[Million Dollar Mile]]'', which was pushed to a Saturday night slot.<ref name=\"premiere\">{{cite web
column11: title=CBS Moves ‘Amazing Race’ Premiere Up A Month, Bumps ‘Million Dollar Mile’ To Saturdays
column18: title=CBS Shifts ‘Million Dollar Mile’ to Saturdays After Just Two Episodes

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The ''Race'' traveled over 25,000 miles across four continent and ten countries, including a franchise-first visit to [[Uganda]] and the first visit to [[Laos]] for the American version.

thumb: Head-to-Head]] returned to this season after it was introduced in the [[The Amazing Race 30
column10: access-date=April 16, 2019}}</ref> This is also the first season to utilize the U-Turn Vote, which has been previously utilized by the [[HaMerotz LaMillion
column14: Filipino]] versions of ''The Amazing Race''.<!--Citation states, \"The U-Turn Vote has been used on four international versions of the show: Israeli, which first introduced it in its second season in 2011, Chinese, Australian and Filipino.\", so mentioning this fact is not SYNTH and complies with trivia guidelines.--><ref>{{cite web
column16: title=Here’s what you need to know about the U-Turn Vote twist on 'The Amazing Race'

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: During the season, [[Rachel Reilly]] broke the record for the number of legs run by a female racer at 32,<ref>{{cite web
250px]]: title=Uh-oh! Rachel Reilly’s new 'Amazing Race' record is in jeopardy
column8: accessdate=November 29, 2019}}</ref> and Leo & Jamal broke the record for the number of legs run by a team at 34.<ref>{{cite web
column10: title=Leo and Jamal (‘Amazing Race’ exit interview) on that lock block: 'It definitely wasn’t one of our brightest episodes'
column15: accessdate=November 29, 2019}}</ref> Tyler & Korey and Colin & Christie also both tied the record for multiple season leg wins at 9 wins each.<ref>{{cite web
column17: title=Colin and Christie also tied these 3 'Amazing Race' records with their win
column22: accessdate=November 29, 2019}}</ref> This season is also the fourth time, after [[The Amazing Race 1
column25: Season 30]], in which the teams that finished in the top three of Leg 1 also made it to the final leg of the ''Race''.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On May 4, 2018, a [[TMZ]] article reported that former ''Big Brother'' houseguests had been asked to compete on the upcoming season of ''The Amazing Race''.<ref>{{cite web

column6: accessdate=March 7, 2019}}</ref> Later that day, [[Andy Dehnart]] posted that former ''Race'' contestants had also been contacted for the same season.<ref>{{cite web
column8: title=Amazing Race season 31: Big Brother vs TAR all-star teams
column13: accessdate=March 7, 2019}}</ref> Martin Holmes from ''Inside Survivor'' then posted that former ''Survivor'' contestants were also in the mix.<ref>{{cite web
column15: title=Former Survivor Contestants on Season 31 of The Amazing Race

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This season involved eleven teams, three of whom previously competed on ''Big Brother'', three of whom previously competed on ''Survivor'', and five of whom previously competed on ''The Amazing Race''. The following teams participated in the ''Race'', each listed along with their placements in each leg and relationships as identified by the program. Note that this table is not necessarily reflective of all content broadcast on television, owing to the inclusion or exclusion of some data. Placements are listed in finishing order:

thumb: red}} team placement means the team was eliminated.

250px]]: cyan ⋑}} indicates that the team chose to use one of the two U-Turns in a Double U-Turn; {{brown
column5: ⋐}} indicates the team who received it; {{sup sub
column9: ⋑}}}} indicates that the team was U-Turned, but they used the second U-Turn on another team; {{brown
column11: ⋑}} indicates that the team voted for the recipient.

thumb: <u>underlined blue</u>}} team's placement indicates that the team came in last on a non-elimination leg and had to perform a [[The Amazing Race#Speed Bump
250px]]: Speed Bump]] during the next leg of the ''Race''.

thumb: orange +}} next to a leg number indicates that there was a [[The Amazing Race#Double Battle/Face Off/Head-to-Head
250px]]: Head-to-Head]] on that leg of the Race, while an {{orange (color)
column4: orange −}} indicates the team that lost the final Head-to-Head and was eliminated.

thumb: 1}} Art & JJ were given a four-hour penalty because Art elected to quit the second Roadblock. Rupert & Laura, the only team trailing, finished the Roadblock and checked-in at the Pit Stop during the penalty time, eliminating Art & JJ.
2}} The Head-to-Head in Leg 4 was unaired.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: At the start of the eighth leg, teams met at the [[Ballenberg]] Community Hall and voted for who should receive the U-Turn. The two teams who received the most votes was penalized with the U-Turn and had to complete both Detour options. The vote was an [[Open ballot system
thumb: open vote]] and the voting order was determined by a random draw. The team's votes, as well as the voting order, is outlined below.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Episode titles are often taken from quotes made by the racers.<ref>{{cite web
#\"I'm a Bird, I'm a Plane, I'm on The Amazing Race\" – ''Korey''
#\"This One is For One Million Dollars\" – ''Christie''
The prize for each leg was awarded to the first place team for that leg. Trips were provided by [[Travelocity]]. The prizes were:
*'''Leg 1''' – A seven day cruise for two to [[French Polynesia]]
*'''Leg 3''' – A trip for two to [[The Bahamas]]
*'''Leg 4''' – A trip for two to the [[Dominican Republic]]
*'''Leg 7''' – A spa day during the Pit Stop
*'''Leg 8''' – A seven night river cruise for two to [[Vietnam]] & [[Cambodia]]

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Tokyo (Shibuya – [https://totalwork.jp/ ACB Lock & Security] ''or'' [http://www.agooddiner.com/sp-mameyakko_shibuya.html Tokyo Tokyo Restaurant])

column4: Who wants to climb Mount Fuji?}}

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the first Roadblock of the ''Race'', one team member had to take part in \"Who wants a sweet new pair of shoes?\", which was inspired by the [[Japanese variety show
thumb: Japanese-style game show]] ''Candy or Not Candy''. They had pick one of several [[Geta (footwear)
250px]]: getas]] and bite the sandal until they found one of twelve made of [[chocolate]]. When they found the correct geta, both team members had to eat the chocolate up to a red line to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For the second Roadblock of the leg, the team member that did not perform the previous Roadblock had to change into a blue [[unitard]] and wig and had to climb up a {{convert
column5: adj=on}} slippery slope that resembled [[Mount Fuji]] to retrieve their next clue at the summit.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After [[Phil Keoghan]] said \"Go,\" teams had to run down the pier to a giant [[octopus]]-shaped [[Sand art and play
thumb: sand sculpture]] on the adjacent beach and dig for their first clue that would reveal their first destination.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *Upon arrival in [[Japan]], teams traveled by a chartered open-top bus to [[Shibuya]]. After disembarking the bus, teams were given a clue, which instructed them to travel on foot to one of two locations to receive their next clue. Each location had a limited number of clues.
*After the first Roadblock, teams had to travel by taxi to [[Onarimon Station]] and then make their way to nearby [[Shiba Park
thumb: Shiba Koen]] to search for their next clue.

column4: Teams began their leg in [[Luang Prabang]] at [[Wat Sen]]soukharam by giving [[alms]] of rice to [[monk]]s.]]

thumb: flight}} Tokyo (Narita International Airport) to [[Luang Prabang]], '''[[Laos]]''' {{flagicon

column4: BBQ}} Luang Prabang (Ecole Maternelle Louang Prabang ''or'' BBQ Alley)

250px]]: Who likes to be in command?}}

thumb: boat}} Luang Prabang ([[Wat Xieng Thong]]) to Ban Xiengkeo ([[Xiengkeo Palace

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The first Detour of the ''Race'' was a choice between ABC and BBQ. In ABC, teams had to make their way on foot to Ecole Maternelle Louang Prabang and had to learn the [[Lao script
thumb: Laotian alphabet]] from a teacher. After learning the alphabet, teams had to pass an oral exam to receive their next clue. In BBQ, teams had to make their way on foot to BBQ Alley and had to purchase three ducks and eight [[tilapia]]s. They then had to prepare eleven Lao barbecue skewers exactly like the skewers prepared during an ongoing demonstration. If the skewers were properly made, teams would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to learn a series of [[Lao language
thumb: Lao]] commands and use these commands to direct an [[Asian elephant
column4: Nam Khan River]]. Once across, they had to search on their elephant for two men playing [[Hmong music]] on [[Lusheng
column5: qeejs]]. When found, team members would receive their next clue and had to direct their elephant back to Elephant Village to reunite with their partner.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After arriving in [[Luang Prabang]], teams had to travel by [[Auto rickshaw

They then had to paddle back to the start and exchange the fish and the basket for their next clue. In Irrigation, teams had to assemble a [[bamboo]] [[water wheel]] to the satisfaction of a farmer and then use the water wheel to fill a jar with water to receive their next clue.

column4: Find}} Dubai ([[Burj Khalifa]] – Mission 828 ''or'' [http://www.dubaigardenglow.com/ Dubai Garden Glow] – Dinosaur Park)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Fall and Find. In Fall, teams had to make their way to the [[Burj Khalifa]] and choose a [[jumpmaster]], who would take them up the building. There, teams would discover that they had to don a [[virtual reality headset]] and use the controls to find a signal interceptor, climb to the top of a simulated Burj Khalifa spire, intercept a [[satellite]], and parachute to the base of the building. After the jump, both team members had to correctly answer a test to receive their next clue, otherwise they would have to attempt the task again. The five questions were: (1) At what height are you in the Burj Khalifa? ({{convert
column5: abbr=on}}); (2) What color was the lever you turned? (Red); (3) What else was inside the glass you broke? ([[Fire hose]]); (4) Did the observation deck door open in or out? (Out); (5) How many antennae were on the signal interceptor? (4). Only two teams could attempt this task at a time. In Find, teams had to make their way to Dubai Garden Glow and don ''[[Tyrannosaurus
column6: Tyrannosaurus Rex]]'' costumes. They then had to search Dinosaur Park for a white, a red, a purple, a blue, and a green glowing [[dinosaur egg]] and place the eggs in a nest to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to enter a [[silent disco
thumb: silent rave]] and had to find a partygoer dancing to the same music as the [[Disc jockey
250px]]: DJ]], a remix of ''The Amazing Race'' theme,<!--as sung by Floyd in the taxi ride to the Pit Stop--> using only their sight to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After arriving in Dubai, teams had to travel to a \"[[supercar]] [[tailgate party]]\". After sampling tea and [[Date palm#Fruit
thumb: dates]], teams would be directed to their next clue inside a supercar.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Amwaj Tower 4, teams had to make their way to the top of the building and ride the world's longest urban [[zip line]] to the Pit Stop at the [[Dubai Marina]]. ,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to find a vendor, who would give them a shopping list. They then had to purchase the ingredients from the list and use their ingredients to properly prepare a [[Rolex (food)
thumb: rolex]] to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: For their Speed Bump, Rachel & Elissa had to hand-wash clothes and then hang them to dry in order to continue racing.

This leg's Detour was a choice between Salty Roll and Move the Pole. In Salty Roll, teams had to bring a wheelbarrow full of the largest freshwater fish in Africa, the [[Nile perch]], to a workstation. They then had to properly [[Salting (food)
thumb: salt]] and roll the fish skin and had to wash, gut, and salt the meat to receive their next clue. In Move the Pole, teams had to load firewood from a canoe onto a bicycle and deliver the wood to a market. There, teams had to stack the wood like a finished example. Once teams delivered and stacked enough wood to reach a specified height, they would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the only aired Head-to-Head of the ''Race'', one member from each competing team had to solve a puzzle similar to the [[Tower of Hanoi]] that consisted of four stacks of [[Ngoma drums]]. Team members had to move one drum at a time until each stack consisted of drums of the same color and grab an ox tail in order to win the Head-to-Head and check-in at the nearby Pit Stop. The team that lost the Head-to-Head had to wait for the next team, and the team that lost the final Head-to-Head was eliminated from the ''Race''.

*At Uganda National Mosque, teams had to don customary clothing. After finding their clue, teams had to climb to the top of the mosque's [[minaret]], counting the marked-steps along the way. If they came up with the correct number (272), they would receive their next clue.
*At Ggaba Landing Site, teams had to find the village boat builders to receive their next clue.

250px]]: water basins]] and amount of water they hold. When their ride ended, teams had to run across a [[Hydroelectricity
column4: hydroelectric dam]] and match the eight basin names to their water capacities on a technical map to receive their next clue. Otherwise, they would have to ride the Gelmerbahn again. In Water Down, teams had to go [[Canyoning

column9: m}} down a canyon, jump from a ledge into a glacial river, and then jump to grab their next clue hanging from a rope. After retrieving their clue, team members had to ride a zip-line and release themselves to drop down into a river before hiking out of the canyon.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Haymaking and Cow Dressing. In Haymaking, one team member had to use a [[scythe]] to cut a lane of grass, while their partner raked it. They then had to properly stack the grass so that it could dry into [[hay]] to receive their next clue. In Cow Dressing, teams had to use the provided materials to make a floral headdress and place it on a [[cattle
thumb: cow's]] head. They then had to lead the cow to a festival and would receive their next clue if the headdress was properly made.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to use a [[crossbow]] to shoot an [[apple]] [[Shooting an apple off one's child's head

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Ballenberg Community Hall, teams found host Phil Keoghan, who informed them that they would be voting for who would receive a U-Turn. After each team openly voted, the two teams with the most votes would be U-Turned. Teams could then retrieve their next clue, while Nicole & Victor would find their Speed Bump.

250px]]: goblet]] and 5 ancient coins, which they could exchange for their next clue after returning ashore.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to enter the [[Roman Senate
thumb: senator's]] room and watch a troop of 18 [[Roman army
250px]]: Roman soldiers]] march in formation. After the soldiers covered themselves with shields, team members had to correctly identify on a podium the five soldiers wearing red ribbons around their helmets to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Bačvice Beach, each team member had to carry out three drinks of [[Punch (drink)

250px]]: Roaming Gnome]], which they had to keep for the remainder of the leg. After returning the trays to the bartender, teams would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Marjan Cave Church, teams had to use a [[pulley]] to pull their gnome to deliver a loaf of bread up to a [[monk]], who would give them their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between High and Dry. In High, teams had to bike to a farm and load a \"Kamper cow\" onto a [[Trailer (vehicle)

250px]]: Nieuwe Toren]] and hoist the cow to the top of the tower within forty seconds. If they could raise the cow within the time limit, then one team member had to climb to the top of the [[bell tower]] to receive their next clue. In Dry, teams had to bike to a farm, where both team members had to pole vault across an irrigation ditch \"[[fierljeppen
column4: the Dutch way]]\". They then had to bring two [[List of Dutch cheeses
column5: cheese]] orbs and a dozen eggs back across the ditch and transport them on their bicycle to Kampen Market intact to receive their next clue.

Teams then had to navigate their boats to the Pit Stop at the island on Bovenwijde Lake.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In this leg's Roadblock, one team member had to decipher a [[World War II]] code. They had to listen to a speech from [[Neville Chamberlain]] and pick out the fifteenth, thirtieth, and fourth words. They then had to translate the letters into numbers based on alphabetical order. Under each number was a group of three letters, which teams had to rearrange into numerical order to reveal the final message. Team members then had to type the message on an [[Underwood Typewriter Company
thumb: Underwood Portable typewriter]] and deliver it to a [[Brigadier (United Kingdom)
250px]]: brigadier]] outside the castle's [[barracks]]. If they gave him the correct message of \"The [[Dunkirk evacuation]] has begun. We will never surrender.\", they would receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: This leg's Detour was a choice between Know and Row. In Know, teams had to ride a [[Hackney carriage
thumb: taxicab]] and had to memorize the fifteen streets and seven landmarks their taxi driver told them during the ride. When teams returned to the [[Cabmen's Shelter Fund
250px]]: cabmen's shelter]] on [[Kensington Road]], they had to correctly recite their route to Dave Cannell, the Master of the [[Worshipful Company of Hackney Carriage Drivers]], to receive their next clue. In Row, teams had to row a [[double scull]] through a {{convert
column7: adj=on}} course on [[The Serpentine]] under one minute to receive their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Gatwick Aviation Museum, teams boarded a helicopter that would take them over the [[Seven Sisters, Sussex
thumb: Seven Sisters]] before landing near [[Dover Castle]], where they would find their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *After the Roadblock, teams had to return to their helicopter, which would fly them to [[London]]. After disembarking, teams had to make their way to [[Piccadilly Circus]] and find the [[Living statue
thumb: golden queen]], who would give them their next clue.

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: *At Camden Market, teams would find the Pit Stop and host Phil Keoghan, who would surprise them with a clue. Teams had to search nearby shops for the marked items in a display and use these items to recreate the display before they could check-in at the Pit Stop.
