,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The [[2019–20 coronavirus pandemic]] has reached mainland [[Denmark]]. The first confirmed case of [[covid-19]] in Denmark was on 27 February 2020.<ref name=\"TV2 first 27Feb\"/> As of 13 April 2020, there have been 6,318 confirmed cases in Denmark.<ref name=\"politi_corona\"/>{{refn
column5: name=fatality}} 2,235 recovered and 388 are in hospital, including 100 in [[intensive care unit

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Denmark was among the first European countries to introduce lockdown measures, starting 13 March.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\"/> Following a period of consistent increase in hospitalizations, the number of people in hospital with COVID-19 has been slowly falling since late March, with number of cases in need of intensive care and [[Mechanical ventilation
thumb: ventilator]]<ref name=\"politi_corona\"/> being well below available resources.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=Håndtering af COVID-19: Prognose og kapacitet i Danmark for intensiv terapi
column8: language=da }}</ref> Starting on 15 April, a very slow and gradual reopening will be initiated, but if there are indications that the number of infections increases too fast, it will be reversed.<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Regeringen åbner vuggestuer, børnehaver og skolen for de mindste børn i næste uge

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In an attempt of reducing the economic impact of the pandemic, [[Frederiksen Cabinet
thumb: the government]] has introduced large economic packages with the support of all parties in [[Folketing
column7: title=Hjælpepakke er klar, men flere kan være på vej: \"Vi vil gøre, hvad der end skal til for at få Danmark igennem den her svære tid\"
column11: language=da }}</ref> nevertheless, it is expected that the decrease in [[GDP]] will be betweeen 3 and 10% in 2020.<ref>{{Cite news
column15: title=Coronakrisen er hård ved økonomien: Nationalbanken forudser, at økonomien skrumper op til ti procent

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 12 January 2020, the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) confirmed that a [[novel coronavirus]] was the cause of a respiratory illness in a cluster of people in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China, which was reported to the WHO on 31 December 2019.<ref name=Elsevier>{{cite web
column14: title=What is coronavirus and how close is it to becoming a pandemic?

thumb: case fatality ratio]] for COVID-19 has been much lower than [[Severe acute respiratory syndrome
column12: title=High consequence infectious diseases (HCID); Guidance and information about high consequence infectious diseases and their management in England
column22: transmission]] has been significantly greater, with a significant total death toll.<ref name=WFSA>{{cite web
column24: title=World Federation Of Societies of Anaesthesiologists – Coronavirus

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: From late January to early February, several groups of Danish citizens were evacuated from China. All were placed in quarantine and tested; none were infected.<ref>{{Cite news
250px]]: title=Yderligere syv danskere evakueres fra Wuhan i Kina

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 27 February 2020, Denmark confirmed its first case when a man named Jakob Tage Ramlyng from [[Roskilde]] tested positive for [[COVID-19]] at [[Zealand University Hospital, Roskilde]]. He was an editor from [[TV 2 (Denmark)
thumb: TV 2]] who had been skiing in [[Lombardy]] in Italy and returned to Denmark on 24 February. He had mild symptoms and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=\"TV2 first 27Feb\">{{Cite news
column12: trans-title=Dane infected with coronavirus}}</ref><ref name=\":6\">{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 28 February, a man who had returned home from a ski holiday in Northern Italy on 15 February tested positive at [[Rigshospitalet]] in [[Copenhagen]] and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=\"sst28February\">{{Cite web
250px]]: title=En person, der er blevet undersøgt på Rigshospitalet, er det andet bekræftede tilfælde af COVID-19 i Danmark
column9: trans-title=A person, that has been tested at Rigshospitalet, is the second confirmed case of COVID-19 in Denmark }}</ref> The case was considered problematic because of the relatively long time that had passed from the person returning to Denmark to him contacting the authorities, increasing the period where he might have infected others and potentially making it more complex for the authorities to locate everybody that had been in close contact with him.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Ny coronapatient har kunnet smitte andre i over en uge
column17: trans-title=New corona patient has been able to infect others in more than a week}}</ref><ref name=DR29quarantine>{{Cite news
column21: title=Derfor er karantæne det bedste våben mod coronavirus lige nu
column27: trans-title=This is why quarantine is the best weapon against coronavirus right now}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 29 February, a man who had returned home from a conference in [[Munich]], Germany, tested positive at [[Aarhus University Hospital]].<ref name=DR29February>{{Cite news
column13: trans-title=Third Dane infected with coronavirus}}</ref> Another attendee at the conference in Germany, an Italian man later found to have [[COVID-19]], is the presumed origin of the Danish man's infection. The Dane was an employee of the Department of Dermatology at Aarhus University Hospital. He had mild symptoms and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=DR29press>{{Cite news
column19: title=LIVE-TV Pressemøde efter tredje corona-fund i Danmark
column25: trans-title=LIVE-TV press conference after the third corona-case in Denmark}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 1 March 2020, a person who was already in home quarantine was tested positive. The person had been in contact with the man tested positive on 28 February.<ref name=\"TV2 4th infection\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Endnu en dansker bekræftet smittet med covid-19
column11: trans-title=Another Dane confirmed infected with covid-19}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 3 March, five people that had visited northern Italy and one person that had visited Iran were tested positive for [[COVID-19]]. All six were placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Femte og sjette dansker smittet med coronavirus
column14: title=Sundhedsminister: Mindst 10 herhjemme er nu smittet med corona

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 4 March, there were four more cases confirmed in (mainland) Denmark and the first confirmed case was reported from the [[Faroe Islands]] (an autonomous territory in the Kingdom of Denmark), bringing the total number of confirmed cases to fifteen. All the new cases were placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=Yderligere fem smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column12: language=da}}</ref> The case in the Faroe Islands was a man with mild symptoms that had returned home from a conference in [[Paris]], France.<ref>{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 5 March, there were five new confirmed cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=20 personer i Danmark er testet positive for coronavirus
column10: language=da}}</ref> One of the cases was former Danish national football player [[Thomas Kahlenberg]], who had been infected at a birthday party in [[Amsterdam]], the Netherlands. This forced the Danish clubs [[Brøndby IF
column12: Lyngby]], and the Dutch club [[AFC Ajax
column13: Ajax]] to place some of their players and coaches, who had recently met with Kahlenberg, into quarantine.<ref name=\"BBC Kahlenberg\">{{cite web
column15: title=Coronavirus: Four Danish league players in quarantine after meeting Thomas Kahlenberg
column18: accessdate=5 March 2020}}</ref> Kahlenberg described his symptoms as similar to a [[flu]], and he was placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column22: title=Brøndby-stjerne med coronavirus: - Jeg er så ked af alt det, jeg har sat i gang
column27: language=da}}</ref> On the same date, the first Dane that had been confirmed infected on 27 February also became the first Dane to be declared fully recovered.<ref name=\"DR første rask 5 March\">{{Cite news
column31: title=Danmarks første coronatilfælde er blevet rask

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 6 March, there were three new confirmed cases, including one in the Faroe Islands (the second case for this archipelago).<ref name=\"TV2 Forsamlinger 6 March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Opfordrer til at udskyde eller aflyse alle arrangementer i Danmark med over 1000 gæster

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 7 March, there were six new confirmed cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=27 danskere er nu smittet med coronavirus - 458 er i karantæne
column10: language=da}}</ref> Most Danes confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 had contracted it abroad, and they had infected a few people in Denmark (there had been no person-to-person spread within Denmark where the source was unknown).<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Styrelse bekræfter: Personer smittet med coronavirus i Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 8 March, there were eight new confirmed cases, including a patient first admitted to North Zealand Hospital [[Hillerød]] with symptoms resembling [[pneumonia]].<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=Nu er 35 personer i Danmark smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> Another mild case where the patient was placed in home quarantine was the first person confirmed to have [[COVID-19]] in the [[North Jutland Region]], meaning that all five [[regions of Denmark]] now had cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Første tilfælde af coronavirus i Nordjylland – nu er alle regioner ramt

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 9 March, there were 53 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 90. Among all those infected, six were in hospital, but none of them required [[intensive care]].<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=LIVE Sundhedsstyrelsen: Vi forventer smittespredning i Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 10 March, there were 172 new cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 262. Among the new cases was one patient admitted to hospital, bringing the total to seven.<ref name=\"JydskeVestkysten 10 March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Opdateret: 262 corona-smittede i Danmark og undgå offentlig transport i myldretid

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 11 March, there were 252 new cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 514.<ref name=\"DR indlagte 11March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Coronavirus: Ti er indlagt - to i kritisk tilstand
column10: language=da}}</ref> One of the cases, who likely had become infected at a meeting where another attendee was infected, caused particular concern because the person worked in a nursing home. As a result, the elderly at the nursing home were isolated in their own rooms, they were closely monitored, and tests were being performed.<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Medarbejder på plejehjem er smittet med coronavirus
column19: language=da}}</ref> Among all the infected people in Denmark, ten patients were in hospital, including two in intensive care.<ref name=\"DR indlagte 11March\"/>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 12 March, there were 160 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 674.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=674 personer er konstateret smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> Among these were two at the nursing home where the elderly had been isolated and closely monitored since the day before because an employee was tested positive.<ref>{{Citation
column15: title=Coronavirus rammer to beboere på plejehjem i Aarhus: 20 ansatte sendes i hjemmekarantæne
column20: language=da}}</ref> On the same date, former footballer Thomas Kahlenberg announced that he had been declared fully recovered, making him the second publicly known recovery in the country.<ref name=\"TV2 Kahlenberg rask\"/> Whereas many early cases were related to people returning from ski holiday in northern Italy, many cases discovered later were related to people returning from ski holiday in [[Tyrol (state)
column25: title=139 skiturister slæbte coronavirusset med hjem til Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: An 80-year-old man with a history of heart disease tested positive after having a heart attack and dying in the North Jutland Region. Although unclear whether the virus had played a role in it,<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=Ældre patient død af hjertestop: Testet positiv for coronavirus efter sin død
column12: language=da}}</ref> the authorities counted it as the first fatality related to COVID-19 in Denmark.<ref name=\"DR first death 14March\">{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 13 March, there were 127 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 801.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=801 personer i Danmark er smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> In addition, the Faroe Islands had their third confirmed case.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Nu er 785 bekræftet smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column18: language=da}}</ref> Among all the infected people in Denmark, 23 were in hospital, including 4 in intensive care.<ref>{{Cite news
column20: title=Corona-tallet stiger: Fire indlagt på intensiv

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 14 March, there were 26 new confirmed cases in (mainland) Denmark, bringing the total to 827.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=827 personer er bekræftet smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column9: language=da}}</ref> Another 6 were confirmed in the Faroe Islands, bringing the total to 9 in this archipelago.<ref>{{Cite news
column18: language=Faroese}}</ref> The second person died from COVID-19 in Denmark, in the [[Capital Region of Denmark
column19: Capital Region]]. It was an 81-year-old that was already weakened due to other serious diseases.<ref name=\"DR first death 14March\"/>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 6 April, Prime Minister [[Mette Frederiksen]] announced what she called the \"first phase\" of the reopening of Denmark:<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\">{{cite news
250px]]: title=Mette Frederiksen: De mindste børn kan begynde i skole og daginstitutioner næste uge
column6: work=[[Altinget.dk]]}}</ref> she announced that nurseries and kindergartens would be opened again on 15 April and that [[Danish Folkeskole Education
column7: ''folkeskole'']] would be reopened for pupils in years 1–6 (Danish: ''0.-5. klasse'');<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" /> furthermore, the final exams for pupils in year 10 (Danish: ''9. klasse''), the last year of the ''folkeskole'', were cancelled.<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" />  Restaurants, cafés and hairdressers are to remain closed until 10 May, and larger gatherings will be prohibited until September.<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" />

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The Danish Health Authority changed its guideline to say that asymptomatic people can transmit the disease, from saying that the risk was \"unconfirmed\" to \"very small\". As documented by Berlingske, there has long been consensus among experts that this was indeed the case (and it had long been widely reported common knowledge), and the health authority was unable or unwilling to defend their previous claim.<ref>{{cite web
column5: work=Berlingske}}</ref> It had previously been strongly criticized that workers in a retirement home were asked to continue working after having had contact with sick persons, again against all expert advice, and apparently because of Danish Health Authority guidelines.<ref>{{cite web
column7: title=Kraftig ekspertkritik: Hvorfor går personalet på plejehjem stadig på arbejde efter tæt kontakt til smittede?

column4: A poster from the [[Danish Health Authority]] ({{lang
column7: Danish]] showcasing measures that can be taken by Danish citizens to limit the spread of COVID-19.]]

250px]]: The autonomous territories of the Faroe Islands and Greenland have their own, but associated hospital systems, that also have prepared for dealing with COVID-19}} [[Aalborg University Hospital]], Aarhus University Hospital, [[Hvidovre Hospital]], [[Odense University Hospital]], Rigshospitalet and Zealand University Hospital Roskilde have sections prepared for serious cases of COVID-19 that require treatment,<ref name=\"DR seks hospitaler 25 Feb\">{{Cite news
column7: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen skærper beredskabet: Seks hospitaler kan behandle coronasmittede
column12: language=da}}</ref> as well as patients that are elderly or have pre-existing conditions and therefore are particularly vulnerable to the disease.<ref name=\"DR2MarchPress\">{{Cite news
column16: title=MINUT FOR MINUT Fjerde dansker smittet med coronavirus - Sundhedsstyrelsen holder pressemøde
column21: language=da}}</ref> Other hospitals were required by the regions to prepare lists of non-essential operations that can be postponed. This would allow the manpower, space and equipment to rapidly be allocated towards an outbreak of coronavirus.<ref>{{Cite news
column25: title=Coronavirus: Region beder sygehuse forberede sig på mangel på personale og materialer
column30: language=da}}</ref> On 11 March 2020, the first hospitals began postponing non-essential operations as a preparation for future cases of COVID-19,<ref>{{Cite news
column33: title=Hillerød Hospital aflyser alle ikke-akutte operationer
column38: language=da}}</ref> and on 17 March this was done in all hospitals nationwide.<ref>{{Cite news
column42: title=Operationer vil blive aflyst på grund af coronasmitte - få overblikket her
column47: language=da}}</ref> Initially, all testing of samples for SARS-CoV-2 was performed at the [[Statens Serum Institut]], but on 25 February (before the first confirmed case in the country) this was expanded to all the hospitals that also had sections that were ready for treating serious cases of COVID-19.<ref name=\"DR seks hospitaler 25 Feb\"/> In early March, other hospitals started to perform the tests.<ref name=\"migogaalborg 11March\">{{Cite news
column50: title=Aalborg følger trop: Kan teste endnu flere med Drive in-test
column55: language=da}}</ref> On 6 March, Aarhus University Hospital made a \"drive-through\" test facility (similar to those used in South Korea) where a person can be tested without having to leave his/her verhicle, but people using it still have to phone their personal doctor or the doctor-on-call ({{lang-da
column61: title=Sygehus laver drive-in test for tjek af coronavirus
column70: title=Sådan fungerer dansk drive-in-test for coronavirus
column75: language=da}}</ref> On 10–11 March, Aalborg University Hospital, Regionshospital North Jutland [[Hjørring]] and Zealand University Hospital Roskilde introduced \"drive-through\" test facilities.<ref name=\"migogaalborg 11March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column79: title=Coronavirus: Region Sjælland indfører drive in-test

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 11 March, the [[Danish Health Authority]] announced a change of strategy, which means that only people hospitalized with severe signs of respiratory illness or shortness of breath, will be examined for COVID-19 infection. As a consequence, it is suspected that COVID-19 cases in the country are underreported, and health officials expect the actual number to be significantly higher than the current amount of confirmed cases.<ref name=\"JPMarchPress\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen skifter strategi: Ikke alle corona-symptomer skal testes

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: According to the guidelines by the [[Danish Health Authority]], all infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed in home quarantine with daily contact from health professionals. Anybody that has been in close contact with someone known to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 is also placed in home quarantine.<ref name=DR29quarantine/><ref name=DR29press/><ref>{{Cite web
250px]]: title=Retningslinjer for håndtering af ny coronavirus \"2019-nCoV\"
column8: language=da}}</ref> As of 2 March, 122 people were in home quarantine in Denmark because they had been in contact with an infected person in Denmark or abroad;<ref name=\"TV2 2 March\">{{Cite news
column14: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen: Op mod 15 procent af danskerne kan blive smittet med coronavirus
column19: language=da}}</ref> by 12 March this had increased to 1366 in Denmark and 31 in the Faroe Islands.<ref name=\"STPS numbers\">{{Cite news
column27: language=da}}</ref> It is expected to further increase as a result of new cases of [[COVID-19]].<ref name=\"FynsAmtsAvis 3March\">{{Cite news
column30: title=Styrelse venter flere i karantæne efter nye coronasmittede
column35: language=da}}</ref> Should it become necessary, each region has its own facilities for quarantining at least one thousand people,<ref>{{Cite news
column46: language=da}}</ref> and if containment of SARS-CoV-2 through normal isolation fails, more drastic measures can be implemented using the Epidemic Law ({{lang-da
column48: links=no}}).<ref name=\"TV2 2 March\"/><ref name=\"DR Epidemiloven\">{{Cite news
column52: title=Myndighederne tager nyt skridt mod coronavirus: Nu kan offentlige arrangementer aflyses

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Initially, the authorities strongly recommended that all events with more than one thousand people be cancelled or postponed, but on 11 March the limit was lowered to one hundred people;<ref name=\"TV2 forsamling 11March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Mette F: Forsamlinger over 100 mennesker skal forbydes
column10: language=da}}</ref> this recommendation covers March, but can be extended if necessary. Among others, football (including the [[Danish Superliga]]) and handball matches were without spectators or entirely cancelled, the [[Dansk Melodi Grand Prix]] did not have an audience, concerts and conferences were cancelled or postponed, and the Euroschoolsport tournament at [[Esbjerg]] High School, where students and teachers from much of Europe were supposed to meet, was cancelled.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Myndigheder vil aflyse arrangementer med over 1000 mennesker
column22: title=Coronavirus påvirker Melodi Grand Prix: Spiller i en tom sal
column29: title=Corona: Kommende kampe spilles uden tilskuere
column38: title=Få overblikket - disse arrangementer er aflyst på grund af coronavirus
column47: title=Internationalt skolestævne i Esbjerg aflyst på grund af coronavirus
column56: title=Superligaen lukkes ned i to uger
column61: language=da}}</ref> The [[Folketing]] (Danish Parliament) cancelled some of their regular meetings and hearings, and when voting a clearing system will be used to avoid having more than 95 members in the main chamber at any one time.<ref>{{Cite news
column65: title=Folketinget begrænser sit arbejde i corona-krise

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 10 March, the authorities recommended that people that use public transportation should attempt to reduce their travel in peak hours, if possible people should walk or bicycle shorter distances instead, and anyone feeling sick in any way or suspecting that they might have [[COVID-19]] should not use public transportation. In an attempt of increasing the space between people using public transportation, more buses and trains were added to the schedules, and there were stricter limits on the number of passengers allowed in each.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Undgå visse rejser og drop tog i myldretiden: Her er myndighedernes corona-anbefalinger
column14: title=Nu skal chauffører afvise passagerer i busserne - få overblikket over den offentlige trafik
column19: language=da}}</ref> From 12 March, all intercity train rides would be limited to people with seat reservations.<ref>{{Cite news
column23: title=Alle elever i Danmark og mange offentligt ansatte sendes hjem

column4: An empty yeast tray in a supermarket in Odense, Denmark, on 17 March 2020. Following the announcement of a general lockdown, there was large-scaling [[panic buying]] of yeast, including both dry yeast and the shorter-lived fresh variety.<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=Gærfabrik til danskerne: 'Bag bare løs. Vi løber ikke tør før efteråret'
column13: title= Hamstring fortsætter: Gær udsolgt i supermarkeder

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 13 March 2020, all people working in non-essential functions in the public sector were ordered to stay home for two weeks.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\"/> In the private sector, employers are urged by the authorities to allow their employees to stay home in the same period and work from there if possible, although this should not affect functions that are essential to the society (such as pharmacy workers and people working with sale of food and maintenance of critical infrastructure).<ref>{{Cite web
250px]]: title=Til dig, der er privat ansat
column4: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column7: accessdate=11 March 2020}}</ref> On that same date, all secondary education (like [[Gymnasium (Denmark)
column8: gymnasium]]s), universities, libraries, indoor cultural institutions and similar places were closed, initially for two weeks. Starting on 16 March, all primary schools, daycare and similar places were also closed for two weeks.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\">{{Cite news
column12: title=Danmark lukker ned: Her er regeringens nye tiltag
column18: Virtual (online) schooling]] was used to some degree.<ref>{{Cite news
column22: title=Gymnasier og folkeskoler gør undervisningen digital: 'Det er ikke nogen badebillet
column27: language=da}}</ref> The municipalities are establishing limited daycare for children where the parents could not stay home and take care of them. Because of the vulnerability of elderly to [[COVID-19]], it was strongly recommended that grandparents should not take care of their grandchildren.<ref>{{Cite web
column29: title=Til dig, der har børn i skole eller dagstilbud
column30: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 18 March at 10:00 AM, a number of further restrictions were activated: it became illegal to assemble more than ten people in public, all shopping centres and stores with close contact such as hairdressers and nightclubs must be closed, restaurants can only serve take-away, and other businesses must ensure that there is enough space between customers.<ref name=\"DR Hvad du ikke må fra 18 Marts\">{{cite web
250px]]: title=Få overblikket over de nye corona-tiltag: Se, hvad du ikke må fra i dag klokken 10

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Unlike previous restrictions on the number of people allowed to assemble, the new restrictions are not merely a recommendation, and breaking the new restrictions is associated with fines of [[Danish krone
thumb: DKK]]1500.<ref name=\"DR Hvad du ikke må fra 18 Marts\"/> On 23 March, it was announced that the above lockdown measures would be extended for a further 2 weeks, and be in place until 13 April.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=Mette Frederiksen: Danmark vil fortsat være lukket ned frem til 13. april

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In late March, authorities acknowledged that the strategy of mitigation had partially worked, but had been less successful than the mass testing in China and South Korea.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Live: Sundhedsstyrelsen og WHO holder pressemøde om håndteringen af coronavirus i Danmark
column8: quote=video}}</ref> Efforts were increased for immediate testing (at [[Novo Nordisk]]),<ref>{{cite web
column11: title=Dual shift at Novo now testing Corona samples
column19: title=Statens Serum Institut (SSI) solves essential COVID-19 testing deficiency problem
column28: quote=several countries are in lack of the chemical reagents necessary to test their citizens for the disease. }}<!--publication list at https://www.jove.com/author/Anders_Fomsgaard#publications , Medrxiv next--> </ref> and local rapid testing for individuals.<ref>{{cite web
column29: title=Devices for rapid diagnosis of coronavirus under development

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: ===International travel, quarantine after return and foreign visitors===

The [[Danish Foreign Ministry]] has changed its travel guidelines several times during the coronavirus outbreak. During the peak of the outbreak in the Chinese mainland, Iran, the regions of [[Aosta Valley]], [[Emilia-Romagna]], Lombardy, [[Marche]], [[Piedmont]] and [[Veneto]] in Italy, [[Ischgl]] in [[Tyrol (state)
thumb: Tyrol]] of Austria, and [[San Marino]], all travel to these places was advised against, and during the peak in the rest of Italy, the rest of Tyrol in Austria, [[Madrid]], [[Basque Country (autonomous community)
column4: La Rioja]] in Spain, parts of Germany, parts of France, parts of Switzerland, and [[Daegu
column5: Daegu City]] and [[North Gyeongsang Province]] (also known as Gyeongbuk) in South Korea, all non-essential travel to these places was advised against. On 13 March, all non-essential travel to the rest of the world was advised against because of the spread of the outbreak, restrictions introduced on foreign visitors (for example, restrictions of flights or forced quarantine), their healthcare system's ability to handle a major outbreak or other reasons indirectly related to the coronavirus pandemic.<ref>{{Cite news
column9: title=Udenrigsministeriet advarer: Tag ikke på unødvendige rejser til Norditalien
column18: title=Udenrigsministeriet fraråder ikke-nødvendige rejser til alle lande
column27: title=Udenrigsministeriet: Nu skal du være ekstra forsigtig i hele verden
column40: title=Hvis du skal ud at rejse
column41: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column44: accessdate=13 March 2020}}</ref> On 13 March, the authorities recommended that all Danes that were abroad (excluding Danes that live abroad) should return to Denmark as fast as possible.<ref name=\"TV2 rejse 13March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column46: title=Danskere i udlandet skal skynde sig at komme hjem
column51: language=da}}</ref> From 14 March to 13 April, all Danish borders will be closed, except for transport of goods, people with an important reason for visiting, foreigners leaving Denmark, and Danes and people with a

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: residence permit returning to Denmark.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Statsministeren lukker grænsen for at bremse coronavirussen
column13: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 3 March, the Danish Government required that all healthcare workers (also including anyone working with care of the elderly) that have travelled to a region with high risk of [[COVID-19]] to stay home for two weeks from the date of their return to Denmark. This was done to reduce the risk of vulnerable people being infected.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Sundhedspersonale risikerer at komme i corona-karantæne
column10: language=da}}</ref> As of 9 March, high risk regions are mainland China, part of South Korea, Iran, Italy and Tyrol in Austria, but are subject to daily reviews by the authorities.<ref>{{Cite web
column12: title=Hvis du har rejst i et risikoområde (Coronavirus/covid-19 in Denmark)
column13: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column16: accessdate=10 March 2020}}</ref> Everybody else that has travelled to these regions are instructed to not visit places like nursing homes and hospitals in two weeks after their return to Denmark (anybody suspecting that they might be infected should phone their personal doctor or the doctor-on-call ({{lang-da
column18: links=no}}) for further instructions<ref name=\"CoronavirusDK hvis syg\">{{Cite web
column20: title=Hvis du bliver syg (Coronavirus/covid-19 in Denmark)
column21: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column24: accessdate=8 March 2020}}</ref>), and it is recommended—but not required—that they also stay home from work for two weeks.<ref>{{Cite web
column26: title=Nye anbefalinger fra Sundhedsstyrelsen om at blive hjemme i to uger, hvis man kommer fra et af de særlige risikoområder
column31: language=da}}</ref> This recommendation was supported by the employers' organisations in the country such as the [[Confederation of Danish Industry]] and the [[Danish Chamber of Commerce]].<ref>{{Cite news
column35: title=Dansk Erhverv om karantæne: Lav en aftale med din chef
column43: title=Regeringen håber firmaer vil lønne karantæneramte
column48: language=da}}</ref> ''Kommunernes Landsforening'', which represents the municipalities in Denmark, made similar recommendations for all children that had visited a high risk region; they should stay home from school, kindergarten, daycare and similar places in 14 days after their return to Denmark.<ref>{{Cite news
column52: title=KL til skoler og institutioner: Lad børn blive hjemme, hvis de har været i corona-risikolande
column57: language=da}}</ref> Foreigners that arrive in Denmark from a high risk region are urged—but not required—by the authorities to follow the same guidelines as Danes and localities for quarantine are available for people that do not already have a suitable locality.<ref name=\"TV2 lufthavn 9 March\">{{Cite news
column61: title=Nye regler i danske lufthavne for passagerer fra coronazoner

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 9 March, passengers on flights that originated in a high-risk region would not have access to Danish airport buildings, but instead were picked up directly from the plane in special busses that could transport them to their home or other locality of quarantine.<ref name=\"TV2 lufthavn 9 March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=Passagerer fra corona-zoner holdes ude af danske lufthavne
column9: language=da}}</ref> From 11 March, all flights from high risk regions were cancelled.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Regeringen indfører begrænsninger i busser, tog og metro - indstiller fly fra ramte områder

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: As of 15 March, among nations with at least one million citizens<!--for example, not counting Iceland, San Marino -->, Denmark has the world's sixth-highest per-capita rate of positive coronavirus cases at 144.3 cases per million people.<ref name=\"worldometer\">{{cite web
250px]]: title=Confirmed Cases and Deaths by Country, Territory, or Conveyance

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the daily report published by [[Statens Serum Institut]] that covered all 785 confirmed cases in (mainland) Denmark as of the morning of 13 March (16 others were confirmed later during the day and not included), it was reported that 67.8% were male and 32.2% female. In terms of age, 10 were 0–9 years old, 30 were 10–19 years old, 134 were 20–29 years old, 135 were 30–39 years old, 253 were 40–49 years old, 159 were 50–59 years old, 50 were 60–69 years old, 5 were 70–79 years old, 7 were 80–89 years old, and 2 were 90+ years old. In terms of origin, 265 had been infected in Austria, 60 in Italy, 2 in Germany, 1 each in Iran, the Netherlands, Spain and the United States, and 158 had been infected within Denmark, while data was pending for the remaining (well above half of those were infected abroad). In terms of residency, 324 live in the Capital Region (160 in [[Copenhagen]], 79 in the Copenhagen upland, 85 in north [[Zealand]], none in [[Bornholm]]), 103 in [[Region Zealand]] (53 in west and south Zealand, 50 in east), 130 in the [[Region of Southern Denmark]] (50 in [[Funen]], 80 in south [[Jutland]]), 175 in the [[Central Denmark Region]] (154 in east Jutland, 21 in west) and 47 in the North Jutland Region, while the remaining 6 are currently in Denmark but live abroad.<ref name=SSI13M>{{Cite news
{{2019–20 coronavirus pandemic data/Denmark medical cases chart}}

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word:
[[Lombardy]], Italy (origin of first Danish case),
[[Tyrol (state)
thumb: Tyrol]], Austria (origin of most imported cases)<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=Statens Serum Institut: 139 danskere på skiferie i Østrig bragte virus med hjem

column9: From 12 March to 1 April, only people with more serious symptoms, vulnerable people and health professionals were tested. From 1 April, testing was again performed more broadly.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Retningslinjer for håndtering af COVID-19 i sundhedsvæsenet
column15: access-date=6 April 2020}}</ref> The actual number of cases is presumed to be significantly higher than the confirmed infections.<ref>{{Cite news
column19: title=123 personer smittet med coronavirus er nu døde - over 1.000 er kommet sig

thumb: severe_cases    = 100 (number of cases in [[intensive care unit
column4: title=Følg smittespredningen globalt, regionalt og lokalt

column5: All people confirmed to have had COVID-19 within 30 days of death are counted, whether or not it is known to have been the cause of their demise<ref name=SSItal/>}}

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The [[2019–20 coronavirus pandemic]] has reached mainland [[Denmark]]. The first confirmed case of [[covid-19]] in Denmark was on 27 February 2020.<ref name=\"TV2 first 27Feb\"/> As of 13 April 2020, there have been 6,318 confirmed cases in Denmark.<ref name=\"politi_corona\"/>{{refn
column5: name=fatality}} 2,235 recovered and 388 are in hospital, including 100 in [[intensive care unit

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Denmark was among the first European countries to introduce lockdown measures, starting 13 March.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\"/> Following a period of consistent increase in hospitalizations, the number of people in hospital with COVID-19 has been slowly falling since late March, with number of cases in need of intensive care and [[Mechanical ventilation
thumb: ventilator]]<ref name=\"politi_corona\"/> being well below available resources.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=Håndtering af COVID-19: Prognose og kapacitet i Danmark for intensiv terapi
column8: language=da }}</ref> Starting on 15 April, a very slow and gradual reopening will be initiated, but if there are indications that the number of infections increases too fast, it will be reversed.<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Regeringen åbner vuggestuer, børnehaver og skolen for de mindste børn i næste uge

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In an attempt of reducing the economic impact of the pandemic, [[Frederiksen Cabinet
thumb: the government]] has introduced large economic packages with the support of all parties in [[Folketing
column7: title=Hjælpepakke er klar, men flere kan være på vej: \"Vi vil gøre, hvad der end skal til for at få Danmark igennem den her svære tid\"
column11: language=da }}</ref> nevertheless, it is expected that the decrease in [[GDP]] will be betweeen 3 and 10% in 2020.<ref>{{Cite news
column15: title=Coronakrisen er hård ved økonomien: Nationalbanken forudser, at økonomien skrumper op til ti procent

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 12 January 2020, the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) confirmed that a [[novel coronavirus]] was the cause of a respiratory illness in a cluster of people in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China, which was reported to the WHO on 31 December 2019.<ref name=Elsevier>{{cite web
column14: title=What is coronavirus and how close is it to becoming a pandemic?

thumb: case fatality ratio]] for COVID-19 has been much lower than [[Severe acute respiratory syndrome
column12: title=High consequence infectious diseases (HCID); Guidance and information about high consequence infectious diseases and their management in England
column22: transmission]] has been significantly greater, with a significant total death toll.<ref name=WFSA>{{cite web
column24: title=World Federation Of Societies of Anaesthesiologists – Coronavirus

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: From late January to early February, several groups of Danish citizens were evacuated from China. All were placed in quarantine and tested; none were infected.<ref>{{Cite news
250px]]: title=Yderligere syv danskere evakueres fra Wuhan i Kina

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 27 February 2020, Denmark confirmed its first case when a man named Jakob Tage Ramlyng from [[Roskilde]] tested positive for [[COVID-19]] at [[Zealand University Hospital, Roskilde]]. He was an editor from [[TV 2 (Denmark)
thumb: TV 2]] who had been skiing in [[Lombardy]] in Italy and returned to Denmark on 24 February. He had mild symptoms and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=\"TV2 first 27Feb\">{{Cite news
column12: trans-title=Dane infected with coronavirus}}</ref><ref name=\":6\">{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 28 February, a man who had returned home from a ski holiday in Northern Italy on 15 February tested positive at [[Rigshospitalet]] in [[Copenhagen]] and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=\"sst28February\">{{Cite web
250px]]: title=En person, der er blevet undersøgt på Rigshospitalet, er det andet bekræftede tilfælde af COVID-19 i Danmark
column9: trans-title=A person, that has been tested at Rigshospitalet, is the second confirmed case of COVID-19 in Denmark }}</ref> The case was considered problematic because of the relatively long time that had passed from the person returning to Denmark to him contacting the authorities, increasing the period where he might have infected others and potentially making it more complex for the authorities to locate everybody that had been in close contact with him.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Ny coronapatient har kunnet smitte andre i over en uge
column17: trans-title=New corona patient has been able to infect others in more than a week}}</ref><ref name=DR29quarantine>{{Cite news
column21: title=Derfor er karantæne det bedste våben mod coronavirus lige nu
column27: trans-title=This is why quarantine is the best weapon against coronavirus right now}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 29 February, a man who had returned home from a conference in [[Munich]], Germany, tested positive at [[Aarhus University Hospital]].<ref name=DR29February>{{Cite news
column13: trans-title=Third Dane infected with coronavirus}}</ref> Another attendee at the conference in Germany, an Italian man later found to have [[COVID-19]], is the presumed origin of the Danish man's infection. The Dane was an employee of the Department of Dermatology at Aarhus University Hospital. He had mild symptoms and was placed in home quarantine.<ref name=DR29press>{{Cite news
column19: title=LIVE-TV Pressemøde efter tredje corona-fund i Danmark
column25: trans-title=LIVE-TV press conference after the third corona-case in Denmark}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 1 March 2020, a person who was already in home quarantine was tested positive. The person had been in contact with the man tested positive on 28 February.<ref name=\"TV2 4th infection\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Endnu en dansker bekræftet smittet med covid-19
column11: trans-title=Another Dane confirmed infected with covid-19}}</ref>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 3 March, five people that had visited northern Italy and one person that had visited Iran were tested positive for [[COVID-19]]. All six were placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Femte og sjette dansker smittet med coronavirus
column14: title=Sundhedsminister: Mindst 10 herhjemme er nu smittet med corona

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 4 March, there were four more cases confirmed in (mainland) Denmark and the first confirmed case was reported from the [[Faroe Islands]] (an autonomous territory in the Kingdom of Denmark), bringing the total number of confirmed cases to fifteen. All the new cases were placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=Yderligere fem smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column12: language=da}}</ref> The case in the Faroe Islands was a man with mild symptoms that had returned home from a conference in [[Paris]], France.<ref>{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 5 March, there were five new confirmed cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=20 personer i Danmark er testet positive for coronavirus
column10: language=da}}</ref> One of the cases was former Danish national football player [[Thomas Kahlenberg]], who had been infected at a birthday party in [[Amsterdam]], the Netherlands. This forced the Danish clubs [[Brøndby IF
column12: Lyngby]], and the Dutch club [[AFC Ajax
column13: Ajax]] to place some of their players and coaches, who had recently met with Kahlenberg, into quarantine.<ref name=\"BBC Kahlenberg\">{{cite web
column15: title=Coronavirus: Four Danish league players in quarantine after meeting Thomas Kahlenberg
column18: accessdate=5 March 2020}}</ref> Kahlenberg described his symptoms as similar to a [[flu]], and he was placed in home quarantine.<ref>{{Cite news
column22: title=Brøndby-stjerne med coronavirus: - Jeg er så ked af alt det, jeg har sat i gang
column27: language=da}}</ref> On the same date, the first Dane that had been confirmed infected on 27 February also became the first Dane to be declared fully recovered.<ref name=\"DR første rask 5 March\">{{Cite news
column31: title=Danmarks første coronatilfælde er blevet rask

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 6 March, there were three new confirmed cases, including one in the Faroe Islands (the second case for this archipelago).<ref name=\"TV2 Forsamlinger 6 March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Opfordrer til at udskyde eller aflyse alle arrangementer i Danmark med over 1000 gæster

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 7 March, there were six new confirmed cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=27 danskere er nu smittet med coronavirus - 458 er i karantæne
column10: language=da}}</ref> Most Danes confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 had contracted it abroad, and they had infected a few people in Denmark (there had been no person-to-person spread within Denmark where the source was unknown).<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Styrelse bekræfter: Personer smittet med coronavirus i Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 8 March, there were eight new confirmed cases, including a patient first admitted to North Zealand Hospital [[Hillerød]] with symptoms resembling [[pneumonia]].<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=Nu er 35 personer i Danmark smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> Another mild case where the patient was placed in home quarantine was the first person confirmed to have [[COVID-19]] in the [[North Jutland Region]], meaning that all five [[regions of Denmark]] now had cases.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Første tilfælde af coronavirus i Nordjylland – nu er alle regioner ramt

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 9 March, there were 53 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 90. Among all those infected, six were in hospital, but none of them required [[intensive care]].<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=LIVE Sundhedsstyrelsen: Vi forventer smittespredning i Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 10 March, there were 172 new cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 262. Among the new cases was one patient admitted to hospital, bringing the total to seven.<ref name=\"JydskeVestkysten 10 March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Opdateret: 262 corona-smittede i Danmark og undgå offentlig transport i myldretid

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 11 March, there were 252 new cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 514.<ref name=\"DR indlagte 11March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Coronavirus: Ti er indlagt - to i kritisk tilstand
column10: language=da}}</ref> One of the cases, who likely had become infected at a meeting where another attendee was infected, caused particular concern because the person worked in a nursing home. As a result, the elderly at the nursing home were isolated in their own rooms, they were closely monitored, and tests were being performed.<ref>{{Cite news
column14: title=Medarbejder på plejehjem er smittet med coronavirus
column19: language=da}}</ref> Among all the infected people in Denmark, ten patients were in hospital, including two in intensive care.<ref name=\"DR indlagte 11March\"/>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 12 March, there were 160 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 674.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=674 personer er konstateret smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> Among these were two at the nursing home where the elderly had been isolated and closely monitored since the day before because an employee was tested positive.<ref>{{Citation
column15: title=Coronavirus rammer to beboere på plejehjem i Aarhus: 20 ansatte sendes i hjemmekarantæne
column20: language=da}}</ref> On the same date, former footballer Thomas Kahlenberg announced that he had been declared fully recovered, making him the second publicly known recovery in the country.<ref name=\"TV2 Kahlenberg rask\"/> Whereas many early cases were related to people returning from ski holiday in northern Italy, many cases discovered later were related to people returning from ski holiday in [[Tyrol (state)
column25: title=139 skiturister slæbte coronavirusset med hjem til Danmark

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: An 80-year-old man with a history of heart disease tested positive after having a heart attack and dying in the North Jutland Region. Although unclear whether the virus had played a role in it,<ref>{{Cite news
column7: title=Ældre patient død af hjertestop: Testet positiv for coronavirus efter sin død
column12: language=da}}</ref> the authorities counted it as the first fatality related to COVID-19 in Denmark.<ref name=\"DR first death 14March\">{{Cite news

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 13 March, there were 127 new confirmed cases, bringing the total in (mainland) Denmark to 801.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=801 personer i Danmark er smittet med coronavirus
column9: language=da}}</ref> In addition, the Faroe Islands had their third confirmed case.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Nu er 785 bekræftet smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column18: language=da}}</ref> Among all the infected people in Denmark, 23 were in hospital, including 4 in intensive care.<ref>{{Cite news
column20: title=Corona-tallet stiger: Fire indlagt på intensiv

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 14 March, there were 26 new confirmed cases in (mainland) Denmark, bringing the total to 827.<ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=827 personer er bekræftet smittet med coronavirus i Danmark
column9: language=da}}</ref> Another 6 were confirmed in the Faroe Islands, bringing the total to 9 in this archipelago.<ref>{{Cite news
column18: language=Faroese}}</ref> The second person died from COVID-19 in Denmark, in the [[Capital Region of Denmark
column19: Capital Region]]. It was an 81-year-old that was already weakened due to other serious diseases.<ref name=\"DR first death 14March\"/>

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 6 April, Prime Minister [[Mette Frederiksen]] announced what she called the \"first phase\" of the reopening of Denmark:<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\">{{cite news
250px]]: title=Mette Frederiksen: De mindste børn kan begynde i skole og daginstitutioner næste uge
column6: work=[[Altinget.dk]]}}</ref> she announced that nurseries and kindergartens would be opened again on 15 April and that [[Danish Folkeskole Education
column7: ''folkeskole'']] would be reopened for pupils in years 1–6 (Danish: ''0.-5. klasse'');<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" /> furthermore, the final exams for pupils in year 10 (Danish: ''9. klasse''), the last year of the ''folkeskole'', were cancelled.<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" />  Restaurants, cafés and hairdressers are to remain closed until 10 May, and larger gatherings will be prohibited until September.<ref name=\"altinget2020-04-06\" />

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: The Danish Health Authority changed its guideline to say that asymptomatic people can transmit the disease, from saying that the risk was \"unconfirmed\" to \"very small\". As documented by Berlingske, there has long been consensus among experts that this was indeed the case (and it had long been widely reported common knowledge), and the health authority was unable or unwilling to defend their previous claim.<ref>{{cite web

250px]]: publisher=Berlingske}}</ref> It had previously been strongly criticized that workers in a retirement home were asked to continue working after having had contact with sick persons, again against all expert advice, and apparently because of Danish Health Authority guidelines.<ref>{{cite web
column5: title=Kraftig ekspertkritik: Hvorfor går personalet på plejehjem stadig på arbejde efter tæt kontakt til smittede?

column4: A poster from the [[Danish Health Authority]] ({{lang
column7: Danish]] showcasing measures that can be taken by Danish citizens to limit the spread of COVID-19.]]

250px]]: The autonomous territories of the Faroe Islands and Greenland have their own, but associated hospital systems, that also have prepared for dealing with COVID-19}} [[Aalborg University Hospital]], Aarhus University Hospital, [[Hvidovre Hospital]], [[Odense University Hospital]], Rigshospitalet and Zealand University Hospital Roskilde have sections prepared for serious cases of COVID-19 that require treatment,<ref name=\"DR seks hospitaler 25 Feb\">{{Cite news
column7: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen skærper beredskabet: Seks hospitaler kan behandle coronasmittede
column12: language=da}}</ref> as well as patients that are elderly or have pre-existing conditions and therefore are particularly vulnerable to the disease.<ref name=\"DR2MarchPress\">{{Cite news
column16: title=MINUT FOR MINUT Fjerde dansker smittet med coronavirus - Sundhedsstyrelsen holder pressemøde
column21: language=da}}</ref> Other hospitals were required by the regions to prepare lists of non-essential operations that can be postponed. This would allow the manpower, space and equipment to rapidly be allocated towards an outbreak of coronavirus.<ref>{{Cite news
column25: title=Coronavirus: Region beder sygehuse forberede sig på mangel på personale og materialer
column30: language=da}}</ref> On 11 March 2020, the first hospitals began postponing non-essential operations as a preparation for future cases of COVID-19,<ref>{{Cite news
column33: title=Hillerød Hospital aflyser alle ikke-akutte operationer
column38: language=da}}</ref> and on 17 March this was done in all hospitals nationwide.<ref>{{Cite news
column42: title=Operationer vil blive aflyst på grund af coronasmitte - få overblikket her
column47: language=da}}</ref> Initially, all testing of samples for SARS-CoV-2 was performed at the [[Statens Serum Institut]], but on 25 February (before the first confirmed case in the country) this was expanded to all the hospitals that also had sections that were ready for treating serious cases of COVID-19.<ref name=\"DR seks hospitaler 25 Feb\"/> In early March, other hospitals started to perform the tests.<ref name=\"migogaalborg 11March\">{{Cite news
column50: title=Aalborg følger trop: Kan teste endnu flere med Drive in-test
column55: language=da}}</ref> On 6 March, Aarhus University Hospital made a \"drive-through\" test facility (similar to those used in South Korea) where a person can be tested without having to leave his/her verhicle, but people using it still have to phone their personal doctor or the doctor-on-call ({{lang-da
column61: title=Sygehus laver drive-in test for tjek af coronavirus
column70: title=Sådan fungerer dansk drive-in-test for coronavirus
column75: language=da}}</ref> On 10–11 March, Aalborg University Hospital, Regionshospital North Jutland [[Hjørring]] and Zealand University Hospital Roskilde introduced \"drive-through\" test facilities.<ref name=\"migogaalborg 11March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column79: title=Coronavirus: Region Sjælland indfører drive in-test

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 11 March, the [[Danish Health Authority]] announced a change of strategy, which means that only people hospitalized with severe signs of respiratory illness or shortness of breath, will be examined for COVID-19 infection. As a consequence, it is suspected that COVID-19 cases in the country are underreported, and health officials expect the actual number to be significantly higher than the current amount of confirmed cases.<ref name=\"JPMarchPress\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen skifter strategi: Ikke alle corona-symptomer skal testes

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: According to the guidelines by the [[Danish Health Authority]], all infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed in home quarantine with daily contact from health professionals. Anybody that has been in close contact with someone known to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 is also placed in home quarantine.<ref name=DR29quarantine/><ref name=DR29press/><ref>{{Cite web
250px]]: title=Retningslinjer for håndtering af ny coronavirus \"2019-nCoV\"
column8: language=da}}</ref> As of 2 March, 122 people were in home quarantine in Denmark because they had been in contact with an infected person in Denmark or abroad;<ref name=\"TV2 2 March\">{{Cite news
column14: title=Sundhedsstyrelsen: Op mod 15 procent af danskerne kan blive smittet med coronavirus
column19: language=da}}</ref> by 12 March this had increased to 1366 in Denmark and 31 in the Faroe Islands.<ref name=\"STPS numbers\">{{Cite news
column27: language=da}}</ref> It is expected to further increase as a result of new cases of [[COVID-19]].<ref name=\"FynsAmtsAvis 3March\">{{Cite news
column30: title=Styrelse venter flere i karantæne efter nye coronasmittede
column35: language=da}}</ref> Should it become necessary, each region has its own facilities for quarantining at least one thousand people,<ref>{{Cite news
column46: language=da}}</ref> and if containment of SARS-CoV-2 through normal isolation fails, more drastic measures can be implemented using the Epidemic Law ({{lang-da
column48: links=no}}).<ref name=\"TV2 2 March\"/><ref name=\"DR Epidemiloven\">{{Cite news
column52: title=Myndighederne tager nyt skridt mod coronavirus: Nu kan offentlige arrangementer aflyses

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Initially, the authorities strongly recommended that all events with more than one thousand people be cancelled or postponed, but on 11 March the limit was lowered to one hundred people;<ref name=\"TV2 forsamling 11March\">{{Cite news
column5: title=Mette F: Forsamlinger over 100 mennesker skal forbydes
column10: language=da}}</ref> this recommendation covers March, but can be extended if necessary. Among others, football (including the [[Danish Superliga]]) and handball matches were without spectators or entirely cancelled, the [[Dansk Melodi Grand Prix]] did not have an audience, concerts and conferences were cancelled or postponed, and the Euroschoolsport tournament at [[Esbjerg]] High School, where students and teachers from much of Europe were supposed to meet, was cancelled.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Myndigheder vil aflyse arrangementer med over 1000 mennesker
column22: title=Coronavirus påvirker Melodi Grand Prix: Spiller i en tom sal
column29: title=Corona: Kommende kampe spilles uden tilskuere
column38: title=Få overblikket - disse arrangementer er aflyst på grund af coronavirus
column47: title=Internationalt skolestævne i Esbjerg aflyst på grund af coronavirus
column56: title=Superligaen lukkes ned i to uger
column61: language=da}}</ref> The [[Folketing]] (Danish Parliament) cancelled some of their regular meetings and hearings, and when voting a clearing system will be used to avoid having more than 95 members in the main chamber at any one time.<ref>{{Cite news
column65: title=Folketinget begrænser sit arbejde i corona-krise

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 10 March, the authorities recommended that people that use public transportation should attempt to reduce their travel in peak hours, if possible people should walk or bicycle shorter distances instead, and anyone feeling sick in any way or suspecting that they might have [[COVID-19]] should not use public transportation. In an attempt of increasing the space between people using public transportation, more buses and trains were added to the schedules, and there were stricter limits on the number of passengers allowed in each.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Undgå visse rejser og drop tog i myldretiden: Her er myndighedernes corona-anbefalinger
column14: title=Nu skal chauffører afvise passagerer i busserne - få overblikket over den offentlige trafik
column19: language=da}}</ref> From 12 March, all intercity train rides would be limited to people with seat reservations.<ref>{{Cite news
column23: title=Alle elever i Danmark og mange offentligt ansatte sendes hjem

column4: An empty yeast tray in a supermarket in Odense, Denmark, on 17 March 2020. Following the announcement of a general lockdown, there was large-scaling [[panic buying]] of yeast, including both dry yeast and the shorter-lived fresh variety.<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=Gærfabrik til danskerne: 'Bag bare løs. Vi løber ikke tør før efteråret'
column13: title= Hamstring fortsætter: Gær udsolgt i supermarkeder

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 13 March 2020, all people working in non-essential functions in the public sector were ordered to stay home for two weeks.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\"/> In the private sector, employers are urged by the authorities to allow their employees to stay home in the same period and work from there if possible, although this should not affect functions that are essential to the society (such as pharmacy workers and people working with sale of food and maintenance of critical infrastructure).<ref>{{Cite web
250px]]: title=Til dig, der er privat ansat
column4: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column7: accessdate=11 March 2020}}</ref> On that same date, all secondary education (like [[Gymnasium (Denmark)
column8: gymnasium]]s), universities, libraries, indoor cultural institutions and similar places were closed, initially for two weeks. Starting on 16 March, all primary schools, daycare and similar places were also closed for two weeks.<ref name=\"TV2 DK lukker 11March\">{{Cite news
column12: title=Danmark lukker ned: Her er regeringens nye tiltag
column18: Virtual (online) schooling]] was used to some degree.<ref>{{Cite news
column22: title=Gymnasier og folkeskoler gør undervisningen digital: 'Det er ikke nogen badebillet
column27: language=da}}</ref> The municipalities are establishing limited daycare for children where the parents could not stay home and take care of them. Because of the vulnerability of elderly to [[COVID-19]], it was strongly recommended that grandparents should not take care of their grandchildren.<ref>{{Cite web
column29: title=Til dig, der har børn i skole eller dagstilbud
column30: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 18 March at 10:00 AM, a number of further restrictions were activated: it became illegal to assemble more than ten people in public, all shopping centres and stores with close contact such as hairdressers and nightclubs must be closed, restaurants can only serve take-away, and other businesses must ensure that there is enough space between customers.<ref name=\"DR Hvad du ikke må fra 18 Marts\">{{cite web
250px]]: title=Få overblikket over de nye corona-tiltag: Se, hvad du ikke må fra i dag klokken 10

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Unlike previous restrictions on the number of people allowed to assemble, the new restrictions are not merely a recommendation, and breaking the new restrictions is associated with fines of [[Danish krone
thumb: DKK]]1500.<ref name=\"DR Hvad du ikke må fra 18 Marts\"/> On 23 March, it was announced that the above lockdown measures would be extended for a further 2 weeks, and be in place until 13 April.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=Mette Frederiksen: Danmark vil fortsat være lukket ned frem til 13. april

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In late March, authorities acknowledged that the strategy of mitigation had partially worked, but had been less successful than the mass testing in China and South Korea.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Live: Sundhedsstyrelsen og WHO holder pressemøde om håndteringen af coronavirus i Danmark
column8: quote=video}}</ref> Efforts were increased for immediate testing (at [[Novo Nordisk]]),<ref>{{cite web
column11: title=Dual shift at Novo now testing Corona samples
column19: title=Statens Serum Institut (SSI) solves essential COVID-19 testing deficiency problem
column28: quote=several countries are in lack of the chemical reagents necessary to test their citizens for the disease. }}<!--publication list at https://www.jove.com/author/Anders_Fomsgaard#publications , Medrxiv next--> </ref> and local rapid testing for individuals.<ref>{{cite web
column29: title=Devices for rapid diagnosis of coronavirus under development

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: ===International travel, quarantine after return and foreign visitors===

The [[Danish Foreign Ministry]] has changed its travel guidelines several times during the coronavirus outbreak. During the peak of the outbreak in the Chinese mainland, Iran, the regions of [[Aosta Valley]], [[Emilia-Romagna]], Lombardy, [[Marche]], [[Piedmont]] and [[Veneto]] in Italy, [[Ischgl]] in [[Tyrol (state)
thumb: Tyrol]] of Austria, and [[San Marino]], all travel to these places was advised against, and during the peak in the rest of Italy, the rest of Tyrol in Austria, [[Madrid]], [[Basque Country (autonomous community)
column4: La Rioja]] in Spain, parts of Germany, parts of France, parts of Switzerland, and [[Daegu
column5: Daegu City]] and [[North Gyeongsang Province]] (also known as Gyeongbuk) in South Korea, all non-essential travel to these places was advised against. On 13 March, all non-essential travel to the rest of the world was advised against because of the spread of the outbreak, restrictions introduced on foreign visitors (for example, restrictions of flights or forced quarantine), their healthcare system's ability to handle a major outbreak or other reasons indirectly related to the coronavirus pandemic.<ref>{{Cite news
column9: title=Udenrigsministeriet advarer: Tag ikke på unødvendige rejser til Norditalien
column18: title=Udenrigsministeriet fraråder ikke-nødvendige rejser til alle lande
column27: title=Udenrigsministeriet: Nu skal du være ekstra forsigtig i hele verden
column40: title=Hvis du skal ud at rejse
column41: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column44: accessdate=13 March 2020}}</ref> On 13 March, the authorities recommended that all Danes that were abroad (excluding Danes that live abroad) should return to Denmark as fast as possible.<ref name=\"TV2 rejse 13March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column46: title=Danskere i udlandet skal skynde sig at komme hjem
column51: language=da}}</ref> From 14 March to 13 April, all Danish borders will be closed, except for transport of goods, people with an important reason for visiting, foreigners leaving Denmark, and Danes and people with a

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: residence permit returning to Denmark.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Statsministeren lukker grænsen for at bremse coronavirussen
column13: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: On 3 March, the Danish Government required that all healthcare workers (also including anyone working with care of the elderly) that have travelled to a region with high risk of [[COVID-19]] to stay home for two weeks from the date of their return to Denmark. This was done to reduce the risk of vulnerable people being infected.<ref>{{Cite news
column5: title=Sundhedspersonale risikerer at komme i corona-karantæne
column10: language=da}}</ref> As of 9 March, high risk regions are mainland China, part of South Korea, Iran, Italy and Tyrol in Austria, but are subject to daily reviews by the authorities.<ref>{{Cite web
column12: title=Hvis du har rejst i et risikoområde (Coronavirus/covid-19 in Denmark)
column13: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column16: accessdate=10 March 2020}}</ref> Everybody else that has travelled to these regions are instructed to not visit places like nursing homes and hospitals in two weeks after their return to Denmark (anybody suspecting that they might be infected should phone their personal doctor or the doctor-on-call ({{lang-da
column18: links=no}}) for further instructions<ref name=\"CoronavirusDK hvis syg\">{{Cite web
column20: title=Hvis du bliver syg (Coronavirus/covid-19 in Denmark)
column21: work=Official website by the Danish authorities (site hosted by Danish police)
column24: accessdate=8 March 2020}}</ref>), and it is recommended—but not required—that they also stay home from work for two weeks.<ref>{{Cite web
column26: title=Nye anbefalinger fra Sundhedsstyrelsen om at blive hjemme i to uger, hvis man kommer fra et af de særlige risikoområder
column31: language=da}}</ref> This recommendation was supported by the employers' organisations in the country such as the [[Confederation of Danish Industry]] and the [[Danish Chamber of Commerce]].<ref>{{Cite news
column35: title=Dansk Erhverv om karantæne: Lav en aftale med din chef
column43: title=Regeringen håber firmaer vil lønne karantæneramte
column48: language=da}}</ref> ''Kommunernes Landsforening'', which represents the municipalities in Denmark, made similar recommendations for all children that had visited a high risk region; they should stay home from school, kindergarten, daycare and similar places in 14 days after their return to Denmark.<ref>{{Cite news
column52: title=KL til skoler og institutioner: Lad børn blive hjemme, hvis de har været i corona-risikolande
column57: language=da}}</ref> Foreigners that arrive in Denmark from a high risk region are urged—but not required—by the authorities to follow the same guidelines as Danes and localities for quarantine are available for people that do not already have a suitable locality.<ref name=\"TV2 lufthavn 9 March\">{{Cite news
column61: title=Nye regler i danske lufthavne for passagerer fra coronazoner

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: Starting on 9 March, passengers on flights that originated in a high-risk region would not have access to Danish airport buildings, but instead were picked up directly from the plane in special busses that could transport them to their home or other locality of quarantine.<ref name=\"TV2 lufthavn 9 March\"/><ref>{{Cite news
column4: title=Passagerer fra corona-zoner holdes ude af danske lufthavne
column9: language=da}}</ref> From 11 March, all flights from high risk regions were cancelled.<ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Regeringen indfører begrænsninger i busser, tog og metro - indstiller fly fra ramte områder

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: As of 15 March, among nations with at least one million citizens<!--for example, not counting Iceland, San Marino -->, Denmark has the world's sixth-highest per-capita rate of positive coronavirus cases at 144.3 cases per million people.<ref name=\"worldometer\">{{cite web
250px]]: title=Confirmed Cases and Deaths by Country, Territory, or Conveyance

,safe,MYLARRRR,"[[File:Fresno State word: In the daily report published by [[Statens Serum Institut]] that covered all 785 confirmed cases in (mainland) Denmark as of the morning of 13 March (16 others were confirmed later during the day and not included), it was reported that 67.8% were male and 32.2% female. In terms of age, 10 were 0–9 years old, 30 were 10–19 years old, 134 were 20–29 years old, 135 were 30–39 years old, 253 were 40–49 years old, 159 were 50–59 years old, 50 were 60–69 years old, 5 were 70–79 years old, 7 were 80–89 years old, and 2 were 90+ years old. In terms of origin, 265 had been infected in Austria, 60 in Italy, 2 in Germany, 1 each in Iran, the Netherlands, Spain and the United States, and 158 had been infected within Denmark, while data was pending for the remaining (well above half of those were infected abroad). In terms of residency, 324 live in the Capital Region (160 in [[Copenhagen]], 79 in the Copenhagen upland, 85 in north [[Zealand]], none in [[Bornholm]]), 103 in [[Region Zealand]] (53 in west and south Zealand, 50 in east), 130 in the [[Region of Southern Denmark]] (50 in [[Funen]], 80 in south [[Jutland]]), 175 in the [[Central Denmark Region]] (154 in east Jutland, 21 in west) and 47 in the North Jutland Region, while the remaining 6 are currently in Denmark but live abroad.<ref name=SSI13M>{{Cite news
{{2019–20 coronavirus pandemic data/Denmark medical cases chart}}
